If you want to find people with similar interests, consider joining a local group or club. Take up a fitness class at the local gym where you can meet people who share your enthusiasm. Check if your town organizes community events, such as cultural festivals, farmers' markets or charity runs, as these are great opportunities to socialize and make new friends.

Explore your favourite hobbies even more by becoming a member of an interest-based club.For example, if you enjoy reading, consider joining a book club. You can share your thoughts and opinions with others and also widen your social circle. Similarly, if you're into sports, join a local sports team where you'll not only get to play but also meet fellow enthusiasts.

Workplaces and schools can also be great platforms to meet new people. Take part in office get-togethers and events at your workplace, or join study groups and extra-curricular activities at your school. By engaging in these, you'll get to know a lot of people, which could lead to meaningful relationships.

topics: Do you like meeting new people?
solutions:
Section One: WH-questions and Suggested Expressions

Who do you often meet? (new friends, colleagues, clients)

What do you find exciting in meeting new people? (Learning new things, discussing about interests, sharing experiences)

When do you usually meet new people? (during events, in a new job, when travelling)

Where are these new people from? (different cities, various countries, diverse backgrounds)

Why do you like meeting new people? (for personal growth, for networking, to improve social skills)

How do you feel about meeting new people? (excited, anxious, curious)

Section Two: Examples Answering the Question

Example 1: I love meeting new friends and colleagues. It's always exciting to share experiences and learn about their lives. I usually meet new people during events or when I start a new job. It's also interesting to meet people from diverse backgrounds and various countries. Achieving personal growth and improving my social skills are the main reasons why I enjoy these interactions.

Example 2: For me, meeting new people is a great opportunity to broaden my horizons. It's exhilarating to discover new cultures and traditions from people who come from different cities and have diverse backgrounds. Whether it's during travel or at social gatherings, I always look forward to the chance to meet and learn from others. The experience always leaves me feeling curious and excited.

Example 3: Encountering new individuals every day is part of my job, and I can honestly say that it's one of the best parts. From clients to colleagues, people from all over the world, I relish the prospect of learning something new. The opportunity to network and enhance my interpersonal skills is invaluable, and the variety of backgrounds I'm exposed to only enhances that experience, making every meeting a cause for celebration.

topics: What do you often talk about with your new friends?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggestions

What are your hobbies or interests?

Suggestions: sports, music, reading, cooking, traveling, games, movies, gardening

Where are you originally from and/or where have you lived?

Suggestions: city names, countries, states, brief descriptions of the environment

Who is someone that has greatly influenced your life?

Suggestions: family members, friends, teachers, famous personalities, authors, artists, scientists

Section 2: Example Answers

One of my biggest passions is gaming. I love all kinds of games, but I am especially fond of strategy and role-playing games on my console. I spend my weekends raiding in games or trying out new releases. I also enjoy going to game industry events and conventions.

I was originally born in San Francisco, but my family moved to Austin, Texas, when I was ten. San Francisco is such a bustling and vibrant city, full of energy and culture. Austin, on the other hand, is warm and friendly with a strong community spirit. I cherish the experiences of living in both places.

My life has been greatly influenced by my literature teacher from high school. She sparked my interest in reading, especially classics and poetry. Her passion for literature was contagious and it inspired me to pursue a career in writing. I owe much of my love for words and storytelling to her guidance and encouragement.

topics: Have you made any new friends recently?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

Who is your new friend? (For example, give their name or describe who they are)

What do they do? (For example, detail their occupation or hobbies)

Where did you meet? (For example, mention the place or event you first met)

When did you meet them? (For example, specify how long ago or the exact date)

Why did you become friends? (For example, share common interests or experiences)

How did your friendship begin? (For example, explain the circumstances that led to the friendship)

Section 2: Example Answers

My new friend is Sam. He is a software engineer and a part-time photographer. We met three weeks ago at a local photography club meeting I regularly attend. We quickly bonded over our shared interest in landscape photography.

I made a new friend named Lily at the office. She recently joined our company as a project manager. We met last month during a team meeting. Our friendship began when we were both assigned to the same project and found out we both love watching Broadway shows.

A new friend I made is Alex. We met at a mutual friend's party two weeks ago. What's interesting is that Alex is a travel blogger, and I'm an avid traveller. We became friends instantly as we shared our travel stories, and we plan to visit a new country together soon.

topics: Did you make a lot of friends when you were a child?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggestions

Who were your primary companions during childhood? Think about friends from school, neighborhood, extra-curricular activities.

What were the activities that brought you closer to your friends? Reflect on shared hobbies or interests, school projects, sports, etc.

Where did you typically meet your friends? Consider places like school, park, neighborhood, sports clubs, etc.

When did you usually spend time with your friends? Think about after school, weekends, holidays, summer breaks.

Why did you become friends with certain people more than others? Reflect on shared interests, personalities, circumstances, etc.

Section 2: Examples

As a child, I had quite a few companions whom I considered friends. Most of them were from my school, as we spent majority of our time together. We had shared interests like playing football and working on science projects, which brought us closer. We usually hung out at the local park after school and on weekends.

Few of my friends from childhood were from my neighborhood. We used to meet regularly either at our homes or at the local park. Our love for bicycles and the countless racing competitions we had, is the major reason why we bonded. We also loved building makeshift tree-houses where we spent our summer holidays.

During my childhood, I was part of a local swim club where I made some of my best friends. We shared a common interest in swimming and would often spend our weekends practicing or participating in swimming competitions. This shared love for swimming and the time we spent together turned us into fast friends.

topics: Do you like making friends?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Phrase Suggestions

Why do you like making friends?

Suggestions: Shared interests, enrich life experiences, emotional support

When did you become interested in making friends?

Suggestions: Childhood, middle school, college, moving to a new city

Who are the people you enjoy making friends with?

Suggestions: People with similar hobbies, empathetic individuals, motivating influencers

What do you gain from making friends?

Suggestions: Emotional wellbeing, personal growth, professional connections

Where do you usually make new friends?

Suggestions: Work, social groups, traveling, online communities

Section 2: Example Answers

Why do I like making friends? I find a great deal of joy in forming connections with different people. Meeting new people broadens my horizons and provides different perspectives on life. I believe that having friends enriches our life experiences and offers much-needed emotional support.

I first understood the value of friendship and became interested in making friends in middle school. It was a time of growth and change for me, and having friends who were going through the same experiences provided comfort and understanding.

What do I gain from making friends? Personally, making friends is about more than just companionship. Itâ€™s about learning from one another, growing personally, and even forming valuable professional connections. Not to mention, the emotional support and shared joy that friends bring to our lives.

topics: Do you prefer to work alone or in a group?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What aspects of teamwork or solo work do you enjoy? (collaboration, brainstorming, independence)

When have you found group or individual work to be most beneficial? (challenging scenarios, smaller tasks, tight deadlines)

Why do you have a preference over group or individual work? (communication styles, work efficiency, personal responsibility)

Who do you find it easier to work with? (team members, leadership, no one)

How does working alone or in a group affect your overall productivity and job satisfaction? (speed of completion, quality of work, enjoyment)

Section 2: Example Answers

I enjoy working in a group because it gives me the opportunity to brainstorm and bounce ideas off other team members. I've found this to be particularly beneficial during challenging scenarios that require a variety of perspectives to solve. This way of working matches my collaborative communication style and positively impacts my job satisfaction.

Given a choice, I prefer to work alone because it allows me to manage my tasks with great independence and efficiency. I find this method most effective when dealing with smaller tasks or projects with tight deadlines. This workflow suits my personal preference and boosts my productivity.

I am flexible and can work in both scenarios effectively; however, I lean slightly towards group work. Collaboration with others often leads to diverse ideas and innovative solutions. Collaboration enhances my sense of responsibility and motivates me to give my best. However, I also value solitary work for its efficiency and the opportunity it provides for deep focus.

topics: Do you prefer to work at home or in the workplace?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggestions

What type of work do you perform and does it require a specific environment?

Suggestions: Type of job, Requirements, Specific tools or technology, Interaction with colleagues or clients

Where do you live and how does it affect your preference?

Suggestions: Home office setup, Distance from company, Commute time, Surrounding environment at home

When do you find yourself most productive?

Suggestions: Day or night, Consistent schedule, Flexibility, Work-life balance

Who else lives with you at home, and how does it affect your work?

Suggestions: Family, Roommates, Distractions, Privacy, Quietness

Why do you find one setting more advantageous?

Suggestions: Productivity levels, Work style, Personal preference, Health issues

Section 2: Example Answers

I'm a software developer and my job requires me to use specific tools and technologies that are thankfully accessible from home. My home office is well set up and it provides me with the peace and quiet that I need to concentrate. Plus, I get to skip the long commute which saves me time. Therefore, I prefer working at home.

My work is mainly collaborative and requires a lot of brainstorming. Being in the workplace provides me the direct communication with my colleagues that I can't get at home. I live not too far from the company so the commute isn't a problem for me. For these reasons, I prefer working in the workplace.

I live with my family and as much as I love them, it can get pretty loud at times making it difficult to concentrate on work. When I'm at the office, I have my own desk in a quiet environment which helps me to be more productive. Besides, the workplace environment motivates me and allows me to learn from my peers. Therefore, I prefer to work in the workplace.

topics: What part of your school do you like the most?
solutions:
WH-Questions and Suggestions

What facilities or elements in your school do you like? (The library, computer lab, sports field, art room, science lab etc.)

Where are they located? (On the school grounds, inside the main building, in a separate building etc.)

Why do you like them? (Because they are well-equipped, spacious, peaceful, inspiring etc.)

When do you usually spend time there? (During lunch break, during particular class sessions or after school etc.)

Who do you usually go there with? (With classmates, friends, alone etc.)

Example Answers

The part of my school that I love the most is the library. It's located right at the heart of the school, which makes it easily accessible for all students. I love it because it's filled with a wide range of books and provides a quiet, calming atmosphere that is perfect for reading and studying. I usually spend time there during my free periods or after classes with my close friends.

I really enjoy the sports field in my school, positioned at the rear end of the school property. I like it not only because it's spacious and well-maintained, but because it allows me to unwind and get involved in physical activities. I often go there after school with my teammates to practice football. The training sessions under the setting sun are quite remarkable.

My favorite area, in school, is the art room. Situated on the second floor of the main building, it's like a vibrant sanctuary filled with diverse art supplies. I find it very inspiring and always brimming with creative energy. I generally visit during art classes and sometimes during lunch breaks. I prefer going there alone as it gives me the freedom to express and enjoy art in solitude.

topics: What is your favourite place to study?
solutions:
WH-Questions and Suggested Phrases

WHERE do you study? In a quiet room, at the library, in a coffee shop, outdoors in a park, in a study group setting.

WHAT time of day do you study? In the early morning, in the afternoon, late at night when it's quiet.

WHY do you choose this place? It's peaceful, it has good lighting, it has resources needed, I can focus better, I feel comfortable, it's convenient.

WITH WHOM do you study? Alone, with a study group, with a tutor, with classmates.

Example Answers

In a quiet room at my home, I tend to hit the books most productively early in the morning when there are minimal distractions. The reason why I choose this place is that it has good lighting and I feel incredibly comfortable in my own space. Moreover, I usually prefer studying alone to be able to focus better.

I frequently study at the local library, usually in the afternoon when it's relatively quiet. The library is always my first choice because it provides all the resources I need, from books to a calming environment. Most of the time, I choose to study alone, but occasionally engage in group studies for subjects that require discussions.

My favorite place to study is a cozy corner in the nearby coffee shop. I lean towards studying late at night when the rush subsides and peace takes over. I choose this place because the ambient noise helps in concentration and the coffee shop conveniently stays open late. Most of the time, I am either studying by myself or occasionally with a study group for brainstorming sessions.

topics: Do you prefer to study at home or in a library?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggested Phrases/Words

What are the benefits and drawbacks of studying at home and in the library?

Suggested phrases/words: Distraction-free, peaceful environment, more resources, privacy, flexibility, convenience, concentration, discipline, comfort

Where do you feel more focused and productive, at home or in the library?

Suggested phrases/words: Home setting, library environment, productivity, procrastination, immersion, focus

When do you prefer to study, day or night, and does the choice of place - home or library - influence this preference?

Suggested phrases/words: Daytime, night-time, opening hours, availability, preference, study schedule

Section 2: Example Answers

I prefer studying at home because it offers a more flexible and convenient environment. Between the two, being at home means I can study whenever I feel like, not restricted by the library's operating hours. The comfort and privacy of my own space allows better concentration, making me more productive.

While I enjoy the comfort of studying at home, I sometimes prefer to study in a library. The environment there helps me focus better without the distractions that come with being at home. Furthermore, I have access to a vast collection of resources which I may need for my studies. Therefore, my productivity and focus are enhanced in a library setting.

I prefer to study in the library during the day and at home during the night. During the day, the libraryâ€™s studious atmosphere and available resources help me to be more productive. However, at night, I prefer the comfort and convenience of my own home without having to worry about the library's closing hours.

topics: What is your favourite place? Why?
solutions:
WH-Questions and Suggestions

What is your favourite place? (A city, a specific location within a city, a country, or maybe even a room in your house)

Where is it located? (Gives specific details about where your favourite place is situated)

Why is it your favourite place? (Specific reasons for your fondness - whether it's the people, the atmosphere, personal memories, etc)

When did you first visit it? (Indicates significance of the place in relation to your personal timeline)

Who do you go there with? (People related to your favourite place)

Example Answers

My favourite place is New York City. It is located in the United States, on the East Coast. It's my favourite place because of its vibrant atmosphere, the diverse range of people, and its iconic landmarks like Times Square and Central Park. I first visited when I was a child, and ever since, I've felt a special connection to the city. I usually visit with my family, and we love exploring what the city has to offer.

My favourite place is the beach near my childhood home. It's a small, hidden gem tucked away in a coastal town. I love it for its tranquillity, the beautiful sunsets, and fond memories of building sandcastles with my siblings. I first visited the beach when I was five, and it has held a special place in my heart since then. Nowadays, I often visit alone or with my dog, to relax and reconnect with nature.

The living room in my house is my favourite place. It's where I feel most at home. It represents comfort, relaxation, and a gathering place for my family. Since I've lived here, the living room has been my recharging spot after a hectic day. I usually spend time there alone, with a good book, or host my close friends and family for dinner parties and movie nights.

topics: Would you take photos when you see a good view?
solutions:
WH-Questions and Suggestions

What stands out about the view to you?

Describing what catches your eye, what is unique or appealing in the view. The composition of the scenery.

Where are you when you see the view?

Details about location, your surroundings, the landscape.

When are you taking the view?

The time of day, the season, any notable weather conditions or atmospheric elements.

Who are you with?

If you're alone, with friends or in a public place.

Why do you want to capture this view?

Express the emotions that the view invokes, personal reasons behind your decision.

Examples answering the question

Upon reaching the top of the hill, the panorama that unfolded before my eyes was simply breathtaking. The what: A sprawling blue lake studded with tiny fishing boats, surrounded by a dense forest charred by the twilight sun. The where: This was atop the solitary hill just outside our small town. The when: A cool summer evening, with clear skies and cotton-candy-hued clouds. The who: I was alone. The why: I wanted to eternalize this enchanting moment into my memory.

I was downtown in the heart of the city when I saw a spectacular view. The what: A dazzling symphony of glittering skyscrapers illuminated against the night sky. The where: On the terrace of a rooftop bar in the business district. The when: It was quite late, midnight. The who: I was with my college buddies, having a reunion after years. The why: It was a perfect blend of nostalgia and joy - a moment that demanded to be captured.

I was at the park when the view caught my eye. The what: An old, gnarled tree clad in fiery autumn foliage spilling colors onto the calm park pond. The where: The serene local park located near my home. The when: Early Sunday morning, golden autumn. The who: I was walking my dog, Charlie. The why: Amid the chaos of city living, it was a moment of tranquility that I needed to capture as a reminder of life's simpler pleasures.

topics: Have you seen an unforgettable and beautiful view or scenery?
solutions:
WH-questions and Suggestions

Where was this unforgettable and beautiful view or scenery located? - Use words like beach, mountain, urban city skyline, forest, park, or river.

What made it unforgettable? - Emphasize the unique aspects: illuminated sunset, magnificent waterfall, vast expanse of the ocean, towering skyscrapers, twinkling stars at night.

Who were you with when you saw it? - Reference specific people or the solitude if you were alone.

When did you see it? - Mention the time: at sunrise, during a full moon, in the fall, during a holiday.

Example Answers

I once witnessed a breathtaking view at the Grand Canyon in the United States. The where is within the sprawling National Park itself. What made it memorable was the vantage point at sunset, where the canyons lit with a fiery glow, creating spectacular shadows on the landscape. I was with my family at the time, making the experience even more special. It was during a summer road trip that I saw this unforgettable scenery.

In my college years, I visited Kyoto city in Japan during the autumn season. The where was Kiyomizu-dera temple, which offered an enchantingly beautiful view of the city, especially with the red and gold fall leaves as the backdrop. The experience, which I shared with my roommates, is quite unforgettable due to the serene ambiance and the mesmerizing union of tradition and nature, what made it unforgettable.

I have a fond memory of standing alone on the summit of Mount Bierstadt in Colorado right at sunrise. The where was at over 14,000 feet high, and what made it unforgettable was the feeling of vastness and tranquility, surrounded by the Rocky Mountains. I was alone at that moment, and the silence and peace were just as awe-inspiring as the panoramic view.

topics: What is the view like around the place where you live?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and suggestions

What natural features can you see from your home? Suggestions: tree types, flowers, parks, mountains, bodies of water, wildlife.

How does the weather and seasons affect the view? Suggestions: snow, autumn leaves, spring blossoms, sunsets, foggy mornings.

Which buildings or urban features are noticeable? Suggestions: skyscrapers, historic buildings, bridges, city lights at night.

Where is the best viewpoint in your home? Suggestions: balcony, rooftop, bedroom window, kitchen window.

When is the view particularly beautiful or striking? Suggestions: sunrise, sunset, after rain, during specific seasons.

Section 2: Examples

From my living room window, I have a panorama of the distant mountains. Their peaks are a dazzling white in winter when they're blanketed with snow. In autumn, the forests at their base become a tapestry of oranges, reds, and yellows. On clear evenings, the sunset paints the sky with hues that blend perfectly with the mountainous horizon.

I live in central downtown, surrounded by skyscrapers. These towering structures, primarily of glass and steel, reflect sunlight during the day, and their windows twinkle with artificial lights after sunset. From my balcony, I spot various landmarks, including the historic city hall and the ornate cathedral tower. The best time to appreciate this view is at night, when the city lights are buoyantly shimmering.

My house is in a suburban area set by a lake. It's particularly magical in spring, when the cherry blossoms on trees around the lake bloom. Wildlife, including ducks, herons and occasionally otters, can be seen from my kitchen window. A stroll in the nearby park at dusk, when the last rays of sunlight sparkle on the lake, is an absolutely serene experience.

topics: When was the last time you laughed?
solutions:
WH-Questions Section

When was the exact moment you last laughed? - The specific time and date, any notable event taking place at that moment.

Where were you when you last laughed? - The location or setting, whether it was alone or in company.

What made you laugh the last time? - One could mention an incident, a joke, a humorous observation, or a funny show or movie.

Who were you with when you last laughed? - Enlist the person or people you were with or if you were alone.

Why did that moment make you laugh? - The reason or the sentiment behind your laughter, connection with a particular humor style.

Answer Examples Section

The last time I laughed was this morning at around 11 AM. I was at home, scrolling through social media on my phone. I came across a hilarious meme related to my favorite TV show that made me burst out laughing. I was alone at the time, sitting comfortably in my living room. The meme was funny because it was a clever play on a line from the show, which tickled my sense of humor.

I last laughed yesterday evening, while watching a stand-up comedy show around 8 PM. I was at a local theater with my friends. The comedian made a witty remark about current societal norms, which made me laugh hard. What made it funny was his unique and satirical take on everyday situations that his audience could relate to.

My last laughter episode happened earlier today at work during lunch break. A colleague told a funny anecdote about his clumsy cooking misadventure. The story was entertaining due to his humorous storytelling skills, combined with the outrageousness of the situation, which caused me to laugh uncontrollably. The whole break room enjoyed a good eye-watering laughter together at that moment.

topics: Do you always laugh at funny things?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggestions

What defines something as funny to you? (Suggestions: Personal humour, Absurd situations, Word play)

Who are the persons whose humor always makes you laugh? (Suggestions: Friends, Comedians, Family members)

When do you find yourself laughing the most? (Suggestions: Comedic movies, Stand-up shows, Social gatherings)

Where are you most likely to laugh at something funny? (Suggestions: At home, In public, At a show)

Why might you not always laugh at funny things? (Suggestions: Mood, Timing, Personal issues)

Section 2: Sample Answers

In response to the question, What defines something as funny to you?â€¨ - I find that my sense of humor is quite eclectic. I usually laugh at absurd situations and comedic word play. Sometimes, it's the unexpected twist in a story that I find truly hilarious. Also, anything that can lighten up serious situations is always a winner with me.

Answering, Who are the persons whose humor always makes you laugh?â€¨ - Undoubtedly, my brother is the one person who never fails to make me laugh. His sharp wit and quirky outlook on life always leave me in stitches. Additionally, I always enjoy the humor of certain stand-up comedians. Their knack for delivering a punchline is just unbeatable.

On the question When do you find yourself laughing the most?â€¨ - I think I laugh the most while watching comedic movies or sitcoms. The comedic timing, humorous dialogue, and laugh-out-loud situations in these usually have me doubled over in laughter. Also, social situations with friends often result in a lot of laughter.

topics: Are you a person who often makes others laugh?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What kind of humor I usually use?

Suggestions: Dry humor, puns, slapstick, situational comedy, self-deprecating.

Who usually laughs at my jokes?

Suggestions: Friends, family, colleagues, strangers, everyone.

Where do I typically make others laugh?

Suggestions: School, workplace, social gatherings, online.

When do I usually make people laugh?

Suggestions: In stressful situations, all the time, at parties, during conversations.

Why do I like making people laugh?

Suggestions: Lighten the mood, brings joy, natural comedian, icebreaker, connect with people.

Section 2: Answer Examples

Example 1: I often make people laugh with my unique blend of dry humor and puns. My family and friends are typically my audience, and they appreciate my comedic flair. I frequently lighten up the mood at home and gatherings. Making people laugh is my way of connecting with them and making any situation entertaining.

Example 2: My colleagues are often on the receiving end of my jokes. I tend to liven up our office space as I dabble with situational comedy. Whether it's during stressful times of meeting deadlines or regular conversations, I use humor as an icebreaker and to maintain a lighter environment.

Example 3: Iâ€™m practically always making people laugh, be it strangers or friends, in public spaces or online. I am a natural comedian who often resorts to self-deprecating humor to get a laugh out of people. For me, making people laugh is a way to share joy and happiness with those around me.

topics: Do you think you are a funny person?
solutions:
WH-Questions and Suggested Phrases or Words

What funny anecdotes do you often tell?

Suggestions: Unexpected situations, Humorous experiences, Comedic timing

Howdo you use humor to lighten up situations?

Suggestions: Jokes, Funny expressions, Laughter therapy

Why do you consider yourself a funny person?

Suggestions: Make people laugh, Good sense of humor, Light-hearted nature

When have you used humor to solve a problem?

Suggestions: Stressful situations, Conflicts, Awkward moments

Examples

I consider myself a hilarious figure indeed! One of the reasons why I think I'm quite funny is because I have an uncanny knack for making people laugh. Even in tense situations, I never shy away from cracking a joke or two to lighten up the atmosphere. Moreover, my humor isn't restricted to only jokes, but also involves an array of funny expressions and gestures that always catch people off guard.

There have been plenty of instances when I've used humor to solve problems. For instance, during a particularly heated meeting at work, I diffused the situation by quipping a light-hearted and well-meaning joke. Not only did this break the tension, but it also helped everyone to refocus on the issue at hand.

Reflecting on what funny anecdotes I often tell, I can recall the one about the time I accidentally went into the women's bathroom at a conference. The story always gets a good laugh because of the absurdity and the comedic timing of the events that followed. I think my ability to laugh at myself and share such stories is a big part of why I view myself as a funny person.

topics: Do you enjoy watching interesting and funny movies?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What type of comedy genres do you enjoy most? (Suggestions: slapstick, romantic comedy, dark comedy, satire)

When was the last time you watched a movie that you found both interesting and funny? (Suggestions: list of dates or events)

Where do you prefer to watch such movies? (Suggestions: home, movie theater, friendsâ€™ place, online)

Who are your favorite actors or directors in comedy and interesting movies? (Suggestions: name of actors or directors)

Why do you enjoy watching interesting and funny movies? (Suggestions: to relax, for inspiration, like comedy, enjoy storyline and plot twists)

Section 2: Examples of Answered Questions

I enjoy a range of comedy genres, but I particularly love romantic comedies and satires. They always leave me in stitches, and the witty humor and relationship dynamics in these movies are so interesting to me.

The last time I watched an interesting and funny movie was in December 2021, during the holiday break. I watched "The Holiday" and I could not stop laughing. The movie was not just funny but had an intricate plot that made it very interesting.

While I enjoy watching movies at the theater for the full cinematic experience, I often watch interesting and funny movies at home. It's more relaxing and I can laugh out loud without potentially disturbing others.

Some of my favorite actors in comedy films include Will Ferrell and Jim Carrey, their comedic timing is impeccable. As for directors, I admire Edgar Wright â€“ his films like "Shaun of the Dead" and "Hot Fuzz" are equally funny and interesting.

I enjoy watching interesting and funny movies because they help me relax and unwind after a long day. They take me to a world filled with laughter, making me forget my worries, and I love the intricate plots and twists that keep me engaged.

topics: What do you dislike about teamwork?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggestions

What problems do you typically encounter with teamwork?

Suggestions: Miscommunication, delayed work, division of responsibility

Why do you find teamwork challenging?

Suggestions: Different work ethics, time management issues, conflicting personalities

When has teamwork caused delays or prevented success in your previous experiences?

Suggestions: Project deadlines missed, inefficient meetings, prolonged discussions

Who within your team sometimes causes the problems?

Suggestions: Dominating personalities, lack of commitment, unequal participation

How do conflicting opinions affect the teamâ€™s overall productivity?

Suggestions: Slow decision making, lack of focus, increased tension

Section 2: Examples

In my experience, what I dislike most about teamwork is miscommunication. It often leads to redundant work or incorrect assumptions and can delay the overall progress of a project. Not everyone has the same clarity about tasks, or they may have a different understanding, which causes confusion.

Why I sometimes find teamwork challenging is due to different work ethics among team members. Some may be diligent and proactive, while others may prefer leaving things to the last minute. This disparity can cause tension within the team and affect the overall productivity.

I have noticed in the past, how conflicting opinions within a team can impact productivity. It can slow down decision-making processes and even lead to unnecessary disagreements. This often shifts the focus from the objective of the project and reduces efficiency.

topics: What do you learn from working in a team?
solutions:
Section 1 - WH-Questions and Suggestion Phrases/Words

What are the key skills developed while working in a team?

Suggestions: Communication, problem-solving, leadership, cooperation, adaptability.

Who benefits from teamwork within the organisation?

Suggestions: Employees, managers, seniors, overall organization.

Why is teamwork important in a professional environment?

Suggestions: Enhanced productivity, brainstorming, employee morale, knowledge sharing.

When does teamwork become essential in a business setup?

Suggestions: During projects, crisis situations, process improvement, decision making.

How does working in a team influence individual learning and growth?

Suggestions: Exposure to diverse perspectives, real-world problem-solving, adaptability, resilience.

Section 2 - Examples

Working in a team helps in honing a variety of skills such as communication, problem-solving, leadership and cooperation. Teams demand constant interaction, decision-making and conflict resolution which can enhance these skills. Further, leading a team or being a part of it allows individuals to understand their potential and work on their weaknesses.

Every member of the organisation benefits from teamwork. Teamwork not only fosters a more inclusive and cordial work environment, but it also ensures everyone's opinions are considered leading to better decision making. On a larger scale, it leads to increased productivity and efficiency which is beneficial for the organisation.

Working in a team is critically important as it allows individuals to learn from each other, thereby enhancing their knowledge and skill set. Exposure to diverse perspectives provides a broadened worldview and helps in developing adaptability and resilience. These qualities are not only beneficial in a professional context but also contribute positively to personal growth.

topics: Have you teamed up with someone else before?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions for Answering

Who was your teammate? Suggestion: Mention the name or the relationship of the person who was your partner.

What was the project or task about? Suggestion: Write briefly about the task or project you and your partner were working on.

When did this team up happen? Suggestion: Indicate the date or period of time when you teamed up with your partner.

Where did you work together? Suggestion: Describe the location or the platform (offline or online) where you and your partner worked.

Why did you choose to work with this person? Suggestion: Explain the reasons behind choosing your partner for the task/project.

Section 2: Example Responses

I teamed up with my college friend, John, for our final year project. We worked on developing a mobile application to assist visually-impaired individuals. This team up happened in the second semester of our final year, around 2019 February. We mostly worked in the college library and sometimes online. The reason why I chose to work with John was his exceptional skills in app development.

Emily, my colleague at work, and I teamed up for a marketing project. The project was about designing a marketing campaign for a new product of our company. It happened last summer. We usually worked at the office, but we also worked at home due to the pandemic situation. I chose Emily as my partner because she has a creative mind and good marketing knowledge.

I worked with Alice, a fellow freelancer, for a web design project. The project required us to redesign a website for a client who wanted a minimalist theme. This collaboration took place two months ago. We worked together online using project management tools. I decided to collaborate with Alice because her exemplary design skills complimented my coding skills.

topics: Do you like teamwork?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What do you like about teamwork? Suggestions: Collaboration, diverse ideas, shared responsibility, motivation, learning from others.

Who has influenced your view on team work? Suggestions: A great team leader, colleagues, successful entrepreneurs, thought leaders, mentors.

When have you experienced successful teamwork? Suggestions: Specific project at work, academic group assignments, sports teams, volunteer experiences.

Why do you prefer to work in a team? Suggestions: Motivation from others, division of labor, variety of skills and perspectives, opportunity for learning.

Where have you encountered challenges with teamwork? Suggestions: Differing opinions, language barriers, time zones, project management, balancing individual tasks with team goals.

Section 2: Example Answers

What do you like about teamwork? I particularly enjoy the collaborative aspect of teamwork. The opportunity to hear different perspectives and to combine individual strengths enriches the overall results. I find that a team can tap into a wider variety of creative solutions than a person working alone. Shared responsibility also makes the workload more manageable.

Who has influenced your view on team work? A mentor at my first job had a profound impact on my view of teamwork. She cultivated a work environment that valued each memberâ€™s contribution and fostered a strong sense of unity. This experience helped me see how effective teams can dramatically improve productivity and morale.

Why do you prefer to work in a team? I find that working in a team offers several advantages, from shared responsibility to a mix of diverse skills. It's exciting to learn from others and be inspired by their ideas. Working in a team also encourages accountability, which in turn ensures consistency in productivity.

topics: Did you ever go fishing when you were a child?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggestions

Who did you go fishing with? (father, mother, grandparents, self)

What kind of fish did you catch? (trout, bass, catfish, nothing at all)

When did you typically go fishing? (summer, after school, weekends, holidays)

Where did you go fishing? (pond, lake, river, sea)

Why did you enjoy it, or why not? (nature, thrill of the catch, didn't enjoy, found it boring)

How did you learn to fish? (taught by a family member, self-taught, from a friend)

Section 2: Answer Examples

I often went fishing with my grandparents during the summer holidays. We would head to the local river and try our luck catching bass. I loved it because I enjoyed being in nature and the thrill of the catch. I was taught how to fish by my grandfather.

As a child, I tried fishing a few times on my own at the pond near our house. It usually happened in the afternoons after school. Unfortunately, I was not very successful and usually caught nothing at all. Despite finding it somewhat boring, I continued attempting it as I was self-taught.

I used to go fishing with my father on weekends. We usually fished in a nearby lake and mostly caught trout. I always enjoyed it as it was a bonding time with my father and I learned a lot about patience and perseverance. My father was the one who taught me how to fish.

topics: Do you like fishing?
solutions:
WH-questions about Fishing

Why do you like fishing? - relaxation, connection to nature, challenge, hobby activity.

What type of fishing do you enjoy? - freshwater, saltwater, fly fishing, ice fishing.

When do you usually go fishing? - weekends, vacations, specific seasons.

Where do you like to go fishing? - near home, favorite fishing spot, travel to new locations.

Who do you go fishing with? - alone, friends, family, fishing clubs.

How did you become interested in fishing? - family tradition, self-taught, influenced by friends.

Example Answers to "Do you like fishing?"

Yes, I really enjoy fishing because it provides a sense of relaxation and allows me to connect with nature. I typically go fishing on weekends at a lake near my home. I picked up the hobby from my father who used to take me fishing when I was a child.

Fishing is indeed one of my favorite pastimes. There's a challenge in it that I find exhilarating. Fly fishing is my preferred type, and I often travel to different locations to try my hand at it. Usually, I head out for these excursions with a group of friends who share the same interest.

I'm an avid ice fisher. The cold, the anticipation, and the unique environment all appeal to me. I generally undertake these adventures during the winter season and it's a treat I eagerly look forward to every year. I am part of an ice fishing club and we usually plan our trips together.

topics: Do you like eating fish?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What type of fish do you prefer to eat?

Suggestions: Salmon, Tuna, Mackerel, Cod

When do you usually eat fish?

Suggestions: Lunch, Dinner, Occasionally, On weekends

Why do you like to eat fish?

Suggestions: Health benefits, Taste, Family tradition, Dietary choice

Where do you usually eat fish?

Suggestions: At home, Restaurants, Family gatherings, Events

How do your prefer your fish cooked?

Suggestions: Grilled, Fried, Baked, Raw (as in sushi)

Section 2: Example Answers

I really enjoy eating fish, especially Salmon, which is my favorite because of its rich and distinctive taste. I usually have it for dinner on weekends. One reason I like eating fish is for their health benefits, they are an excellent source of protein and omega-3 fatty acids. Most of the time, I eat fish at home, but occasionally I'll enjoy it at a restaurant. As for preparation, I prefer my fish grilled, it brings out the best flavor.

I like eating Tuna. Usually, I have it for lunch and it's become a part of my diet because I appreciate the incredible health benefits it offers. Particularly, I love eating it at restaurants where it's served as sushi. This allows me to enjoy the fish in its raw form, which I find extremely delicious.

Eating fish is something I really enjoy due to its taste and it has long been a family tradition. Mackerel is the type of fish we usually eat, and we often have it for dinner, especially on family gatherings. We usually enjoy having fish at home, lovingly cooked by our mother. She bakes the fish to perfection which we all find delectable.

topics: Is fishing popular in your country?
solutions:
Section 1: Suggested WH-questions, Phrases and Words

WH-questions:

  • What types of fishing are popular?
  • Where are the popular fishing spots?
  • Who are the main demographics that fish in your country?
  • How many people take part in fishing either as a hobby or profession?
  • Why is fishing popular in your country?
  • When is the peak fishing season?

Suggestions in phrases and words:

  • Type of fishes caught, catch and release, saltwater fishing, freshwater fishing, angling, commercial fishing, recreational fishing, deep sea fishing, fishing tournaments, bait, fishing gear, fishing license, fishing boats.

Section 2: Sample Answers

Fishing is quite popular in our country with a significant number of people taking part in it either as a hobby or profession. BASS fishing and fly fishing are some of the most popular types of fishing here. We have a range of fishing spots from lakes and rivers to coastal areas offering both freshwater and saltwater fishing. The peak fishing season usually starts from mid-summer through early autumn, with several fishing tournaments taking place during this time.

In our country, fishing is a popular sport among people of all ages. Both commercial and recreational fishing contribute significantly to our economy. Deep-sea fishing and angling are among the most preferred types of fishing. Popular fishing spots include the coastal areas and interior lakes and rivers. As for the peak fishing season, it is during the spring when the fish are spawning, making them easier to catch.

The popularity of fishing in our country can be credited to our rich aquatic biodiversity and the fact that we have a long coastline and numerous freshwater bodies. Whether for leisure or as a means of livelihood, people engage in different types of fishing such as catch and release, fly fishing, and bait fishing. Some of the popular fishing spots include our coastal areas, lakes, and rivers. The peak fishing season generally begins from late spring and extends till early fall.

topics: Do you spend a lot of money on buying perfume?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What kind of perfumes do you usually buy? Luxury brands, designer, niche, or affordable ones?

Where do you usually buy your perfumes? At a boutique, online, or at duty-free shops?

When do you usually make your perfume purchases? Seasonally, during sales, or when you run out?

Why do you buy perfumes? For personal use, as gifts, or for collection?

Who are you buying the perfume for? Yourself, family, friends, or a significant other?

Suggestions: brand preference, purchasing habit, timing, frequency, purpose, budget for perfumes

Section 2: Examples

I do enjoy buying perfumes, but I wouldn't say I spend excessively. I adore luxury brands and niche fragrances, but I only buy them seasonally or during sales. I mostly buy perfumes for personal use, but occasionally I'll pick up one or two as gifts. My purchases are usually made online or at specialty boutiques.

Yes, I do spend quite a bit on perfume. I have a love for designer perfumes and rarely miss a chance to add to my collection. My purchases are done both at duty-free shops when I travel and online. It's something I buy for myself and my significant other, even when I still have some left. The frequency of my purchases shows that it's something I budget for.

I wouldn't say I spend a lot, but perfumes are a necessary expense for me. I'm not picky about brands; whatever smells good and fits my budget, I'll buy. I make my purchases when I run out, and occasionally during sales. I usually buy from online platforms where I can get discounts. Perfumes are predominantly for personal use in my case.

topics: Do you send perfume to others as a gift?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

Who is the recipient of the gift? (friend, family, partner, colleague)

What is the occasion? (birthday, anniversary, promotion, just a token)

When do you usually send gifts? (holidays, milestones)

Where do they live? (nearby, different city, overseas) This might affect the choice based on shipping restrictions.

Why choosing perfume? (personal preference, known preference of recipient, ease of shipping)

How well do you know their preferences? (Close Friends/Family: Preferences known; Acquaintances/Colleagues: Generic Fragrances)

Section 2: Examples

For a close friend's birthday, giving a perfume as a gift could be a nice personal touch. Since we've been friends for a long time, I know that she loves minty and aquatic fragrances, so I choose a perfume that suits her taste. I usually order online and have it delivered to her directly.

In our office, we have a yearly Secret Santa event. Last year, I was assigned to a colleague whom I didn't know on a personal level. I decided to get a unisex, popular perfume so it's suitable and safe. I ordered it online and chose to have it gift-wrapped with a personalized card.

My brother recently promoted to a higher position at work. To celebrate, I decided to send him a luxury men's perfume. Given we live in different cities, I purchased it from an online store and requested direct delivery to his place. I chose the perfume based on the reviews and description.

topics: Where do you spray perfume?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

Where are the most effective places to spray perfume?

Suggestions: Wrist, neck, behind the ears, elbow area, behind the knees.

When should you spray perfume?

Suggestions: Before leaving the house, before a date, before a meeting.

Why do people typically spray perfume on their wrists and neck?

Suggestions: Pulse points, body heat, longevity, intensity.

What are some reasons to avoid spraying perfume on clothing?

Suggestions: Stain risks, residue, not skin-absorbed, irritating fabrics.

Section 2: Pertinent Responses

Perfume is typically sprayed on the neck and wrists because these are pulse points where the body naturally produces more heat. Increased body heat can help the perfume project further from your body and last longer. In addition, it's generally a good idea to spray perfume close to the body before you dress to prevent the perfume from leaving any residue or stains on your clothing.

It's generally best to spray perfume before you leave the house or before attending a special event. Applying it at these times allows the scent to settle into your skin and mix with your body oils to create a unique aroma. It's also important to be mindful of spraying perfume around other people to avoid potential allergies or sensitivities.

While spraying perfume directly onto your skin is the most common method, it's not the only place where perfume can be applied. For some, spraying perfume on clothing is preferred due to longer scent longevity, but it's important to consider the material and color of the clothing as darker fabrics might show residue and certain fabrics might potentially get damaged.

topics: Do you use perfume?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggestions

What brand of perfume do you use? Suggestions: Chanel, Versace, Dior

Why do you use this particular perfume? Suggestions: Good scent, Compliments personality, Presents a specific image

When do you normally use perfume? Suggestions: Everyday, Special occasions, Business meetings

Where do you typically apply perfume? Suggestions: Wrist, Neck, Clothes

Who introduced you to this perfume? Suggestions: Friend, Family member, Work colleague

Section 2: Examples of Answers

I usually use Chanel's No. 5 perfume. I was introduced to it by a close friend who swears by Chanel's line of fragrances. I use it mainly on special occasions since I appreciate its unique and classy scent. Generally, I apply it on my wrist and neck, areas known to retain the perfume scent longer.

I am a huge fan of Versace's Eros perfume. My reason for using this perfume is its fresh and vibrant scent which I believe complements my energetic personality. Besides, I use it daily as it acts as my signature scent. I usually apply the perfume on my clothes for the scent to last throughout the day.

I use Dior's J'adore perfume, mostly for business meetings. I enjoy its sophisticated and elegant scent which in my opinion, presents a professional image. It was my sister who introduced me to Dior's line of perfumes. I typically apply it on my wrist and neck for a long-lasting effect.

topics: Do you like perfume?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions & Suggestions

What kind of perfume do you like? (Floral, woodsy, fruity, oriental, etc.)

Why do you like perfume? (Elevates mood, confidence booster, personal signature, enhances style, etc.)

When do you usually wear perfume? (Daily, special events, dates, job interviews, etc.)

Where do you apply your perfume? (Wrists, pulse points, behind ears, etc.)

Who introduced you to wearing perfume? (Parent, friend, celebrity influence, etc.)

Section 2: Examples Answers

I enjoy wearing perfumes, particularly those with a light floral note. Wearing perfume boosts my confidence and gives me a sense of personal style. I usually wear my perfume daily; a quick spritz on my wrists and behind my ears does the trick. It was my mother who first introduced me to the world of fragrances.

Yes, I love perfumes with a woodsy note. It has a power to elevate my mood and positively affects people around me. I tend to wear perfumes mostly during special occasions to leave an unforgettable impression. I usually apply it to my pulse points for long-lasting fragrant. My best friend back in high school was the one who introduced me to the habit of wearing perfume.

I do have a penchant for perfume, especially the fruity ones. They have become the signature of my style that people immediately recognize. I can't imagine going out without applying some. Giving a generous spray on my neck and chest is my usual way of application. Interestingly, it was a celebrity's signature scent that enticed me to start using a perfume.

topics: Are there any famous roads or streets in your country?
solutions:
WH-Questions and Suggestions

What is the name of the famous road/street? (Name of the road)

Where is this road/street located? (City, district, region)

Why is this road/street famous? (Historical event, tourist attractions, landmarks)

When was it built or named? (Year, era, period)

Who usually uses this road/street? (Tourists, locals, specific groups of people)

Examples

The What question: Route 66 is one of the most famous roads in the United States. It is also known as the Main Street of America or the Mother Road.

The Where question: Route 66 spans over 8 states, starting in Illinois and ending in California. It was a major path for those who migrated west, especially during the Dust Bowl of the 1930s.

The Why question: Route 66 is famous for its rich history as one of the first highways in the U.S highway system. It also showcases the diverse landscapes of America, including its small towns, rural areas, and metropolitan centers. The road has been immortalized in numerous songs, films, and books.

The When question: Route 66 was established on November 1926, with road signs erected the following year.

The Who question: Route 66 is often frequented by tourists who wish to experience a road trip across America. It was historically used by those migrating west, particularly during the Dust Bowl. Today, many visitors come from around the world to experience this iconic road.

topics: Do you think the roads in your city need improvement?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What is the current condition of the roads in your city? (e.g., numerous potholes, broken sidewalks, unclear street markings)

Where are the roads most in need of improvement in your city? (e.g., specific areas, highways, residential streets)

Why do the roads in your city need improvement? (e.g., safety issues, congestion, promoting access for pedestrians and cyclists)

When was the last time the roads in your city were improved or repaired? (e.g., years of neglect, recent work done but not sufficient)

Who is responsible for maintaining the roads in your city? (e.g, city council, local government, department of transportation)

Section 2: Answered Questions Examples

The current condition of the roads in our city is deplorable. There are numerous potholes and missing street signs especially in heavily trafficked areas. The sidewalks are cracked and dangerously uneven, posing a risk to pedestrians.

The roads that are most in need of improvement are in the downtown area and the local highways. The road surfaces there are extremely worn out. In addition, the street markings are faded and the traffic signs are hardly visible which is very concerning.

The main reason why our roads need to be improved is to increase the safety of all road users. Currently, there are too many accidents due to poor road conditions. Moreover, improving road infrastructure could help to ease traffic congestion, as well as promote cycling and walking by creating bike lanes and pedestrian-friendly pathways.

topics: What is the condition of the roads in your city like?
solutions:
WH-Questions and Suggestions:

What is the general condition of the roads in your city? - Describe the overall status of the road system. Suggest phrases: Well-maintained, large potholes, heavily trafficked.

Where are the most problem areas? - Provide information on problematic spots. Suggest phrases: Busy intersections, residential areas, pedestrian crossways.

When were the roads last repaired or refurbished? - Mention the time of the last roadworks or renovations. Suggest phrases: Recently paved, long-overdue repairs, outdated infrastructure.

How does the condition of the roads affect commute times? - Explain the impact on daily travels. Suggest phrases: Longer drive times, frequent traffic jams, road closures.

Why has/might the condition deteriorated over time? - Discuss any factors contributing to the current state. Suggest phrases: Heavy use, severe weather, lack of funding.

Example Answers:

What is the general condition of the roads in the city? - The general condition of roads in our city is quite varied. Some areas, particularly the business districts, have well-maintained, smooth-running roads. However, in the outskirts or less affluent parts of the city, it is not uncommon to come across roads with large potholes and cracks that haven't been addressed.

Where are the most problematic areas? - The most problematic areas are usually in residential neighborhoods and busy intersections. These are often heavily trafficked, and despite regular maintenance, road damages are frequent. Construction areas also pose as problematic spots due to temporary rerouting and uneven surfaces.

When were the roads last repaired or refurbished? - The major roads and highways in the city were last refurbished a couple of years ago, but some less-used residential streets have not been updated for many years. There are now plans for these long-overdue repairs, but the work has not yet started.

topics: How do people cross the road in the city where you live?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggestions

What safety measures are in place at pedestrian crossings in your city?

Suggestions: Pedestrian signals, crosswalk zebra lines, safety islands.

Where are the most popular crossing areas in the city?

Suggestions: Near shopping centers, schools, parks, and public transportation stops.

When do pedestrians usually wait to cross the road in your city?

Suggestions: Traffic signal transitions, late at night, early in the morning.

Section 2: Example Answers

In my city, Standard safety measures such as pedestrian signals, crosswalk zebra lines, and safety islands are used at most pedestrian crossings. Pedestrians are encouraged to use these facilities to ensure their safety while crossing the road.

The most popular crossing areas are typically located near places with high pedestrian traffic. These places include shopping centers, schools, parks, and stops for public transportation. At these locations, crosswalks are much more common and are usually marked with zebra lines for ease of visibility.

Most pedestrians in my city tend to wait to cross the road when the traffic signal allows them to. However, outside of peak hours, such as late at night or early in the morning, pedestrians may judge the traffic situation for themselves and cross the road when they deem it safe to do so.

topics: Are the roads and streets in the area where you live busy?
solutions:
WH-Questions and Suggested Phrases or Words:

When is the area the busiest? - Rush hour, weekend, special events, holidays.

Where do people normally go? - Malls, parks, schools, offices, tourist spots, theaters, restaurants.

Who are the usual people on the roads or streets? - Commuters, kids, employees, tourists.

What are the means of transportation mostly seen? - Cars, buses, bicycles, motorcycles, trams.

Why are the roads and streets busy? - Business district, residential area, school zone, high population density, tourist attraction, busy infrastructure.

Example Answers:

In the area where I live, the roads and streets are the busiest during the morning and evening rush hours. This is when people are commuting to and from work or school, using various forms of transport like cars, buses, and bicycles. The foot-traffic also tends to increase during these times, making the streets crowded.

The streets in my area are usually busy because it's a residential area with a high population density. You'll typically see kids on their way to school in the morning and employees rushing to their offices. During weekends, the streets are crowded with people visiting the malls, parks, and restaurants located in nearby places.

I live in a business district, so the roads and streets here are always bustling with activity. It's most busy during weekdays when employees fill the streets, and numerous cars and buses move around the area. However, it's also busy during weekends since there are shopping malls and theaters here that draw the crowd.

topics: Did you use coins as a child?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

Who gave you your first coin? Father, mother, grandma, grandpa, brother.

What was the denomination of the first coin you used? Penny, nickel, dime, quarter, half-dollar.

When did you start using coins? Childhood, as a teenager, adult, first job.

Where did you mostly use your coins? School cafeteria, local store, bus fare, vending machines.

Why did you start using coins? To buy lunch, for transportation, to collect, to donate, for small purchases.

How did you feel when you first started using coins? Proud, responsible, grown-up, excited, nervous.

Section 2: Answer Examples

My father gave me my first coin. It was a shiny dime, and I remember feeling incredibly proud of it. I used it to buy a small toy from a local store. It was my first independent purchase, and I cherished that toy as a symbol of responsibility.

I began using coins in childhood, mostly for the school cafeteria. My parents gave me a dollar each day, and I would use it to buy my lunch. On days where there were vending machines at school, Iâ€™d use my coins to get a treat.

I started using coins to collect them. My grandpa gifted me a coin collection book when I was a kid. I cherished each coin I found, be it a penny, a nickel, or a dime. Looking for different year markings and mints turned out to be quite exciting.

topics: Do you use coins in your daily life?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggested Phrases/Words

Who gives you coins regularly?- bank teller, cashier, grandma

What do you typically use coins for?- parking meter, toll booths, vending machines

When do you use coins?- during shopping, daily commute, Sunday flea market

Where do you usually spend your coins?- supermarket, local stores, public transit

Why do you prefer to use coins?- maintain tradition, easier transactions, like the feel

How often do you use coins in a day/- every day, rarely, occasionally

Section 2: Sample Responses

My grandmother, who is somewhat old-fashioned, often gives me coins. I typically use them for small purchases at local stores or for my commute. I use coins every day as I like the feel of them and find them convenient for small, quick transactions. Although I also use digital transactions, using coins gives me a sense of nostalgia and maintaining tradition.

As a college student, I often get coins from cashiers during shopping. I usually use them for vending machines and laundry machines in my dorm. Besides, I also use them at the parking meter when I drive to the nearby town on weekends. I use coins quite frequently, as they're smaller and easier to handle for these minor expenses.

I work at a bank, so I regularly receive coins from the bank teller. I use them mostly for toll booths on my daily commute as it's a faster transaction. Occasionally, I also use them at the Sunday flea market. I don't use coins every day, but their convenience for toll booths and small, quick purchases is undeniable.

topics: Is it convenient to use coins?
solutions:
WH-questions and Suggestions

What are the uses of coins?

Suggestions: transaction, collection, investment

Where are coins commonly used?

Suggestions: vending machines, coin-operated laundry machines, toll booths

Why might someone prefer to use coins over paper money or electronic payments?

Suggestions: tangible, ease of use, availability, traditional feel

When can coins be more convenient than other forms of payment?

Suggestions: small transactions, emergency situations, for children's use

Examples Answering the Question

Coins can be convenient in situations where small transactions are required, such as in vending machines, toll booths, or public transportation systems. They are easy to carry around, always available and accepted universally, moreover, they don't require any technological infrastructure to use.

What makes coins convenient is their tangibility and ease of use. They serve as an excellent form of transaction for those who prefer a traditional approach to payment. Additionally, coins can be a popular choice for collectors and investors due to their historical and intrinsic value.

Compared to paper money or electronic payments, coins can be more practical and handy in certain instances. For example, when teaching children about money management, the physical aspect of coins can make it easier for them to understand the concept of spending and saving. Coins can also prove beneficial in emergency situations where electronic modes of payment aren't accessible.

topics: Have you ever collected coins?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What types of coins do you collect? (Historical coins, foreign coins, rare coins)

When did you start collecting coins? (Childhood, adulthood, after a significant event)

Why do you enjoy collecting coins? (Interest in history, passion for numismatics, investment purposes)

Where do you usually find the coins for your collection? (Garage sales, auctions, travels)

Who inspires you to collect coins? (Family, friends, famous coin collector)

How do you take care of your coin collection? (Cleaning methods, storage, insurance)

Section 2: Example Answers

What: I specialize in collecting historical coins. I find the stories behind them fascinating, and each coin serves as a tiny fragment of the past. My collection includes coins from different eras, such as Roman coins, medieval coins, and coins from the Colonial period.

Why: My grandfather, an ardent numismatist himself, nurtured my interest in coin collecting. His stories about the coins and their origin got me intrigued. I also realized that these coins are not just pieces of metal; they serve as tangible connections to history, presenting a real sense of continuity.

How: Preserving the integrity of the coins is crucial in this hobby. I gently clean the coins using soft cloths and specific solutions to avoid damaging them. I also invest in proper storage, like archival-quality holders, to maintain their condition. Additionally, I regularly catalog them for easy reference and insurance purposes.

topics: Do you often carry coins with you?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggestions

Why do you often carry coins with you? Suggestions: ease of payment, preference for physical money, nostalgic value, etc.

What do you typically use the coins for? Suggestions: vending machines, parking meters, tips, etc.

When do you find carrying coins most useful? Suggestions: during travels, at the laundromat, at cash-only places, etc.

Where do you usually keep the coins? Suggestions: coin purse, wallet, car, etc.

Who typically gives you coins? Suggestions: Bank tellers, from using cash, change from purchases, etc.

Section 2: Example Answers

I often carry coins with me because I find they're useful for smaller transactions and I like having physical money. I typically use them on parking meters and vending machines. I find carrying coins most convenient when I'm traveling in areas where parking lots still rely on coin-operated meters. I usually keep the coins in my car in a small coin holder.

I always carry coins with me as it's part of my daily routine. Primarily, I use them to tip at restaurants and cafes and occasionally for vending machines and laundromats. I find carrying coins extremely handy when I'm at cash-only places or where card payments aren't accepted. I usually keep my coins in a small section of my wallet specifically made for coins.

I carry coins with me because it is a habit I picked up from my grandfather. He used to say that you never know when a coin can come in handy. I usually use them for small errands and also whenever I have to use a parking meter. Most often I find them useful at old fashioned vending machines that still take coins. I keep them in a small coin purse that my grandfather gave me.

topics: Do you want to be a teacher in the future?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What makes you drawn to the teaching profession? (adjectives describing your interest, specific areas in teaching you're passionate about, the potential of influencing young minds)

Who or what inspired you to consider teaching as a career? (a mentor, previous teachers, personal experiences, love for a particular subject)

When did you first have an interest in becoming a teacher? (stages in life, specific experiences catalyzing your interest)

Where would you like to exercise your teaching practice - a public school, a private institution, abroad? (ideal teaching environment, target group of students, type of institution)

Why do you believe teaching could be a fulfilling job for you? (your values, how teaching aligns with those, the rewarding moments of teaching)

Section 2: Example Answers

The idea of working with young minds and guiding them towards gaining knowledge influences my interest in teaching. I am drawn to the aspect of helping students explore their potential and watching them grow.

I've held an interest in becoming a teacher ever since high school. The teachers I had the privilege of learning from played a significant role in molding my personality. Their dedication and passion for teaching inspired me to give back in the same way.

The reason I find teaching fulfilling is that it's not just about imparting knowledge; it's about shaping the future. It involves mentoring, guiding, motivating and instilling values in students, which I consider to be a great responsibility and an honor.

topics: Do you have a teacher from your past that you still remember?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggested Phrases or Words

Who was your teacher?

Suggestions: Mrs. Brown, Mr. Ramirez, Professor Smith

What subject did they teach?

Suggestions: math, history, English, physical education

When did you have this teacher?

Suggestions: elementary school, high school, college, graduate school

Where did this teacher teach?

Suggestions: Springfield Elementary, Bayside High, Harvard University

Why do you remember this teacher?

Suggestions: inspiring lectures, tough grading, kind personality, impactful life lessons

How did this teacher impact your life or academic career?

Suggestions: sparked interest in subject, improved academic skills, served as a mentor, inspired career path

Section 2: Examples

One teacher I still remember is Mr. Ramirez from high school. He taught history at Bayside High. What made him memorable was his passion for the subject, his engaging teaching methods, and his unwavering support for his students. Acknowledging the potential in me, he inspired me to pursue an academic career in history.

Another unforgettable teacher is Mrs. Brown, my math teacher in elementary school. She never gave up on us, even when we struggled with complicated concepts. Her patience, encouragement, and innovative methods made it fun and eventually led to my lifelong love for numbers.

Professor Smith from Harvard University is another teacher I remember well. As my English professor, he challenged my thinking, pushed my writing skills, and never settled for mediocrity. His rigorous grading made me a better writer, shaping my career into journalism today.

topics: Are you still in touch with your primary school teachers?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggestions

Who were your primary school teachers that had a significant impact on you?

Suggestions: Name of the teachers, Subject they taught, specific examples of how they influenced you

What methods of communication do you use to keep in touch with them?

Suggestions: Email, social media platforms, phone calls, in person meetings

When did you last have a conversation with any of your primary school teachers?

Suggestions: Specific dates, events, description of the meeting

Why do you feel it's important to stay connected with your primary school teachers?

Suggestions: Their influence on personal growth, educational advice, nostalgic reasons, lifelong mentorship

How have they reacted to your progress and achievements over the years?

Suggestions: Their comments, their advice, expressions of pride, personal stories

Section 2: Examples of answering the question

For me, my Grade 3 teacher, Mrs. White significantly impacted my love for science. We have stayed in touch through the years via email correspondences. I last spoke to her at the beginning of this year when she wished me happy new year. She's always pleased with how far I've gone in my career, often expressing how proud she is of my accomplishments.

I am still in contact with my primary school Math teacher, Mr. Edwards. We connect mainly through Facebook where he regularly updates about his life. Our last conversation was around three months ago during a reunion meet. His delight upon hearing about my promotion was visible, and he reiterated how he always believed in my capabilities.

My primary school teacher, Miss Johnson, who taught me English has always been a pillar of support for me. We generally catch up over phone calls or meet during her annual visits to our city. The last time I met her was four months ago. She's incredibly proud of my achievements, often sharing my success stories with her current students.

topics: In what way has your favourite teacher helped you?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What specific skills or knowledge did this teacher impart?

Suggestions: Critical thinking, problem-solving techniques, the importance of openness and adaptability, research skills, a deeper understanding of the subject matter.

How did this teacher encourage or inspire you?

Suggestions: Through personal stories, motivational speeches, their enthusiasm and passion for the subject, or through their belief in your potential.

Why do you consider this teacher your favourite?

Suggestions: The manner in which they teach, their personality, the respect they gave students, their dedication to teaching, their ability to make complicated topics easy to understand.

Section 2: Examples

My favourite teacher, Mrs. Smith, was instrumental in honing my critical thinking skills. She encouraged us to question everything and seek answers logically and rationally. Through her, I learned the importance of thorough research, keen observation, and using evidence to back up my arguments.

Mr. Johnson, my maths teacher, was a continuous source of inspiration. He shared personal stories of his struggles and how he overcame them, which pushed us to never give up. His enthusiasm for maths was infectious, and I found myself developing a keen interest in the subject, even when I initially struggled with it.

I consider Mrs. Davis my favourite teacher for several reasons. She was the epitome of dedication to teaching and cared genuinely about our growth and development. Respect was a two-way street in her classroom, and she had the remarkable ability to simplify complex topics so that we not only understood them but also loved learning about them.

topics: Do you have a favorite teacher?
solutions:
WH-Questions and Suggestions for Answering "Do You Have a Favorite Teacher?"

WHO was your favorite teacher? (e.g., Mr./Ms./Dr. [Name], a high school teacher, a college professor.)

WHAT subject did they teach? (e.g., Mathematics, Science, English, History.)

WHEN did you have this teacher? (e.g., In the 5th grade, during high school years, in my final year of university.)

WHERE did you have this teacher? (e.g., At [Name] School, at [Name of University], at an after-school program.)

WHY is/was this teacher your favorite? (e.g., Inspiring teaching methods, supportive attitude, made the subject interesting.)

Example Answers for "Do You Have a Favorite Teacher?"
