Who is an athlete that you admire? I really admire Michael Jordan. He had an incredible career in basketball and demonstrated immense talent and dedication. Not only did he achieve personal success, but he also led his team, the Chicago Bulls, to win multiple championships.

What sport do they play? He is renowned for playing professional basketball but he also had a brief career in baseball. His legacy in basketball is particularly impressive, with many regarding him as the best player in the history of the sport.

Where do they usually practice or compete? While active in his career, he would most often train and compete in the United Center, the home stadium of the Chicago Bulls. He also had private training facilities for his personal practice sessions.

When did they start playing the sport? He started playing basketball competitively in high school. His talent was apparent early on and he quickly rose through the ranks, playing in college and then becoming a professional NBA player.

Why do you think they are good at their sport? His natural talent was certainly a driving force, but his relentless dedication, practice, and competitive spirit played a huge role in his success. He had a reputation for always pushing his limits and constantly working to improve his game.

topics: Do you think students need more exercise?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions in Phrases and Words

What are the benefits of more physical activity for students?

Suggestions: Improved focus, mental well-being, stress reduction, enhanced social skills.

Why would more exercise be beneficial for students?

Suggestions: Healthier lifestyle, obesity prevention, improved academic performance.

When can physical activities be incorporated in the students' daily schedule?

Suggestions: Physical Education (PE) classes, break times, before or after school.

How can schools and parents ensure students get more exercise?

Suggestions: Introducing more engaging sports activities, walking or cycling to school, enhancing PE curriculum.

Section 2: Examples with Answers

Acknowledging the benefits of physical activity, it is valid to say that students do need more exercise. More exercise can lead to improved focus and mental well-being for the students. An active body promotes an active mind, and thus helps them to concentrate better in their lessons.

Additionally, more exercise would help prevent students from leading a sedentary lifestyle. With the rise of technology, children are more likely to be inactive, leading to potential health complications like obesity. Providing more avenues for exercise can mitigate this issue and promote a healthier lifestyle among students.

Physical activity can be incorporated into the daily schedules of students. Schools should make use of PE classes and break times effectively. Also, parents can play a role by encouraging activities like walking or cycling to school. A combined effort from schools, parents, and the community can ensure that students get their needed physical activity.

topics: Did you do some sports when you were young?
solutions:
WH-Questions and Suggestions

Which sports did you engage in when you were young? Soccer, swimming, basketball, baseball, gymnastics, tennis, golf, karate, ballet.

When did you start participating in these sports? Early childhood, elementary school, middle school, high school.

Who introduced you to these sports or who was your influence? Family, friends, physical education teacher, sports coach.

How often did you participate in these sports? Daily, weekly, seasonally, during school, during summer.

Why did you choose these particular sports? Interest, passion, fitness, competition, socializing, talent.

Answer Examples

I was heavily involved in sports during my childhood and adolescence. I started playing soccer at the tender age of five after being introduced to the sport by my elder brother. I would play after school nearly every day, fuelled by both my passion for the game and the chance to compete. The sport taught me valuable lessons about teamwork, perseverance, and discipline that have carried over into my adult life.

I joined my neighbor's little league baseball team when I was in elementary school. My neighbor was a coach, and his passion for the sport was contagious. It quickly became my favorite pastime, and I would spend countless summer afternoons polishing my batting and fielding skills. This sport helped me develop my hand-eye coordination and tactical thinking.

My mother enrolled me into ballet classes at the tender age of eight. Dancing three times a week allowed me to express myself in a more creative and graceful way than other sports. I was very passionate about ballet because it challenged me both physically and mentally, and it also served as a unique form of self-expression.

topics: Where did you learn how to do it?
solutions:
WH-Questions and Suggestions

Who taught you how to do it? (father, mother, teacher, friend, self-taught)

Where did you learn how to do it? (home, school, online, in a specific city or country)

When did you learn how to do it? (childhood, teenager, recent years, specific date/ year)

Why did you want to learn how to do it? (personal interest, work needs, hobby, necessity)

How did you learn how to do it? (practice, tutorials, lessons, trials and errors)

Example Answers

I learnt how to cook my favourite dish from my mother. Since she's an excellent cook, she's been my primary source of learning. Our kitchen was my general spot to learn, and I picked up these skills over my teenage years. I wanted to learn it because cooking was something I found joy in and being able to cook my favourite meal was an added bonus. I learnt by direct lessons from my mom and also a lot of trial and error.

As a kid, my father taught me how to ride a bike. He would take me to the local park in our town every evening after his work. His teachings and the desire to participate in the local bike race was a compelling reason for me to learn it. I learnt by practicing daily at the park with my father's guidance.

As an adult, I learned how to play guitar from watching tutorials online. My interest in music and the desire to play my favourite songs urged me to learn it. I used YouTube tutorials, and regular practice helped me to learn it. I started learning it two years ago, and now I can play some of my favourite songs on the guitar.

topics: What sports do you like?
solutions:
WH-Questions and Suggestions

What kinds of sports are you interested in? (Team sports, Individual sports, Winter sports, etc.)

Why do you enjoy these particular sports? (Excitement, Exercise, Socializing, etc.)

When did you first become interested in these sports? (Childhood, High School, College, etc.)

Where do you often play these sports? (Local gym, School, Sport club, etc.)

Who do you usually play these sports with? (Friends, Family, Teammates, etc.)

Examples

I have always loved playing team sports, especially, football and basketball. I enjoy them because of the excitement they bring and the way they allow for team bonding. I first became interested in these sports during my school years, playing them at the school field with my classmates.

I am a big fan of individual sports such as tennis and swimming. These sports not only help me stay fit but also help me enjoy my own time. I started playing them in college and the local community center is usually my go-to place to play these sports. Most of the time, I either play alone or with my close friends.

Winter sports like skiing and ice hockey are my top favorites. The thrill and adrenaline rush they provide are unlike any other sport. I first got into these sports when I went on a winter vacation with my family. Since then, I usually take part in these sports at a local winter sports club with my family and friends.

topics: What part of your day do you like best?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggested Phrases/Words

What specific activities or tasks do you enjoy doing during your favorite part of the day? Ideas: Cooking breakfast, morning jog, working, after-work relaxation.

When during the day do you feel most productive or at ease? Suggestions: Morning, afternoon, evening, night.

Where are you usually during this part of the day? Suggestions: Home, outdoors, office, gym.

Who are you typically with during this time? Suggestions: Family, friends, colleagues, alone.

Why do you enjoy this part of the day the most? Suggestions: More energy, calmness, fun activities, less distractions.

Section 2: Example Answers

My favorite part of the day is the evening. When the work day has ended, I feel the most at ease. I'm usually at home during this time, with my family. We enjoy cooking dinner together and catching up on our days. Why I love this time is because it's our family bonding time which is quite special to me.

I most enjoy the early morning. What I do at this time is going for a run in the park. The fresh air and tranquility of the morning adds to my joy. Where this occurs is usually in the local park, and I'm typically alone. Why is because I relish the peace and solitude, it helps me clear my mind for the day.

The best part of my day is the afternoon. When the day is in full swing, I feel the most productive. My preferred location is the office where I'm often surrounded by my colleagues. We work as a team to complete our tasks and it's quite fulfilling. Why this is my favorite part is because I'm a very career-oriented person, and I find great satisfaction in my work.

topics: Do you think it is important to have a daily routine for your study?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

Why would a daily routine be beneficial for studying? Consistency, habit formation, efficient use of time

What could be the possible consequences of not having a steady study routine? Procrastination, ineffective studying, overwhelmed

How can one create and maintain a daily study routine? Scheduling, prioritizing, frequent breaks, goals

When is it the best time to study? Personal preference, morning, night, during free time

Who should consider having a daily study routine? Everyone, students, professionals, lifelong learners

Section 2: Examples

Creating a daily routine for study is important as it helps to form a habit. Just as we set aside time for meals or exercise, setting aside time for studying makes it a normal part of our day. This way, it wouldnâ€™t feel like an imposing task, but rather a usual activity, making it easier to start and progress.

Without a daily study routine, it's easy to procrastinate and waste time. We might find ourselves cramming all our studies into one or two days out of the week, which can overwhelm our brain and hinder effective learning. With a consistent daily routine, we can break down our study goals into manageable daily tasks and avoid stress.

Anyone can benefit from a daily study routine. For students, it helps them manage their homework, revision and self-study effectively. For working professionals pursuing further studies or learning new skills, a study routine helps to juggle their work, personal life, and studies effectively. Lifelong learners too can benefit from a study routine to steadily progress in their areas of interest.

topics: Have you ever changed your routine?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggestions for Answering

What was the reason for changing your routine? (motivation, necessity, new goals)

How did you decide to change your routine? (self-initiation, recommendation, unexpected factors)

When did you start implementing the changes in your routine? (specific time, period of transition, after an event)

Which part of your routine did you change the most? (morning, work, evening, exercise, diet)

Who influenced or helped you in changing your routine? (friend, family, professional coach, self-help book)

Section 2: Examples of Answers

I changed my routine due to a what - sudden increase in my work responsibilities. I how - decided to wake up earlier in the mornings to manage my tasks more efficiently, and this change started when - at the beginning of this year. The which part - morning schedule of my routine transformed drastically with this initiative. And who - I took this decision independently, without any external influence.

The what - motivation to lead a healthier life inspired me to change my routine. I how - decided to incorporate a daily exercise regime and healthier eating habits. I started making these changes when - right after my annual health check-up six months ago. The which part - diet and workout routine underwent a significant change due to this. My gym instructor who - played a crucial role in this change.

An unexpected health concern made me reconsider my lifestyle, which in turn changed my routine. That's the what - reason behind the shift. The doctor's advice how - led me to make healthier choices and reduce stress in my life. It happened when - about two years ago and primarily affected the which part - work and relaxation aspects of my routine. The who - doctor played a huge role in this transition.

topics: What is your daily study routine?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggestions

What is your main study objective for the day?

Suggestions: Finish a chapter, solve exercises, review previously studied content.

When do you usually start your study routine?

Suggestions: Early morning, afternoon, late at night.

Where do you prefer to study?

Suggestions: At home desk, local library, school/university study room.

Why do you choose this particular study routine?

Suggestions: Enhances focus, covers all subjects, aligns with personal energy levels.

How do you maintain concentration during your study routine?

Suggestions: Short breaks, meditation, regular exercise, nutritional snacks.

Section 2: Examples

I revolve my study routine around my main objective for the day which is usually to finish a specific chapter. I tend to begin studying early in the morning because it's when I'm most alert and focused. I prefer studying at home, at my personal study desk, as it provides me a sense of comfort and ease. I've selected this routine as it is in sync with my energy levels and maximizes my productivity. To maintain my concentration, I make sure to take short breaks every hour and keep myself hydrated.

My study routine usually starts in the afternoon when I finish all my tasks. My primary objective tends to rotate between practicing problem-solving and reviewing previous content. I prefer studying in a local library, where the atmosphere promotes focus and discipline. I prefer this routine since it keeps my study sessions varied and interesting. I maintain my concentration by taking a walk around the library every hour or so.

I start my study routine late at night when there are minimal disturbances. My focus is usually on understanding new concepts and practicing related problems. I study in the quiet study room at my university, where I can easily access resources if I need them. I chose this routine because it gives me the freedom to study at my own pace. I ensure I maintain my concentration by doing a few minutes of meditation before starting and by taking regular breaks.

topics: Do you like science?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What aspects of science fascinate you the most?

Suggestions: the laws of physics, quantum theory, genome editing, space exploration, the human body's complex systems, nature conservation, etc.

When did you develop an interest in science?

Suggestions: during childhood, in high school, upon visiting a science museum, after watching a science fiction movie or discovery channel, etc.

Why do you find science appealing?

Suggestions: its role in solving complex problems, the mystery around scientific phenomena, how science advances technology, more understanding about the world, etc.

Section 2: Answered Examples

I have always been intrigued by what aspects of science can impact society and the world. The laws of physics and our understanding of space and the universe in particular fascinate me beyond imagination. I am deeply interested in how these concepts are used to understand the workings of the cosmos.

My interest in science sparked when I was a child. I still remember watching my very first episode of Cosmos: A Personal Voyage. The engaging and insightful scientific explanations opened up a new world for me - the world of science, which I instantly fell in love with.

Why science appeals to me is because of its critical role in solving real-world problems. From creating sustainable solutions to preserving biodiversity to making remarkable advancements in medical science, the potential of science is limitless. It provides us with logical explanations and effective ways to improve our standard of living.

topics: When did you start to learn about science?
solutions:
WH-Questions and Some Suggestions in Phrases and Words

When did you first start learning about science? (e.g., early school years, high school, etc.)

Where did you begin your science education? (e.g., at school, at home, online etc.)

What was the first field of science you were introduced to? (e.g., biology, chemistry, physics etc.)

Who inspired you to learn about science? (e.g., a teacher, a family member, a famous scientist etc.)

Why did you start learning about science? (e.g., natural curiosity, interest in the natural world, future career etc.)

Examples Answering the 'When did you start to learn about science?' Question

I began learning about science during my early school years. Science lessons were a part of my school curriculum from the first grade. I remember being intrigued by the various phenomena around me and wanting to understand the logic behind them. The school environment provided me the platform to learn and understand the basics of different fields in science.

Science was a subject that I was introduced to in high school. Until then, my education didn't emphasize much on scientific knowledge. I only had a basic understanding of the natural world, but high school opened up a new world for me. We touched upon various aspects, including biology, chemistry, and physics, which sparked in me a genuine interest in science.

I only started learning about science during my college years. My high school education was focused mainly on the arts. It wasn't until I took a general education science course in college that I really started to explore this field. I was awestruck by the beauty and complexity of the natural world, prompting me to further delve into different scientific fields.

topics: Which science subject is interesting to you?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and suggestions

What about this science subject attracts you? (i.e., the complexity, the unknown, the opportunity for exploration)

Why do you find this area of science so fascinating? (i.e., passion for learning, problem-solving aspect, the connection to everyday life)

When did you start finding this science subject interesting? (i.e., in a class, reading a book, watching a documentary)

Who inspired your interest in this science subject? (i.e., a teacher, a scientist, a family member)

How does this area of science impact your life or viewpoint? (i.e., environmentally conscious, better understanding of health, increased curiosity about the world)

Section 2: Examples of responses

I am drawn to astrophysics because of its complexity and vastness. The vast, unexplored expanse of space has always intrigued me. My interest was first sparked when I watched a documentary about black holes. I was captivated by the mystery and scale of these celestial phenomena.

My interest in environmental science was mostly inspired by my biology teacher. He made me aware of the delicate equilibrium of ecosystems and the critical role that humans play in preserving them. Consequently, this has shaped my viewpoint to become more environmentally conscious and has influenced my everyday choices such as recycling and reducing plastic use.

Molecular biology fascinates me because it allows me understanding the minutest details of life on a cellular level. This motivation primarily comes from my inherent curiosity and inclination towards problem-solving. I find it extremely rewarding to grasp the complexities of life on such a detailed scale, which has bolstered my passion for research and discovery.

topics: What kinds of interesting things have you done with science?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggestions

What is the most fascinating scientific experiment you have conducted?

Suggestions: Replication of classic experiments, cutting-edge research, ground-breaking discoveries

Why did you choose the particular field of science for your experiment?

Suggestions: Personal passion, intellectual curiosity, utility, societal improvement, career prospects

When did you experience a 'eureka' moment that led to a scientific breakthrough?

Suggestions: Detailed procedural steps, unexpected outcomes, successful trial run, sudden insights

Section 2: Examples of answers

In my scientific journey, the most fascinating experiment I conducted was the DNA extraction from a tomato. This experiment was not only interesting because it was my first encounter with the tangible side of genetics, but it also gave me an insight into the meticulous process that is genetic research. It was interesting to see how something so complex as a DNA molecule could be isolated from such a common item as a tomato.

I selected Environmental Science as my field of focus primarily out of personal passion. Being an outdoor enthusiast, I was closely familiar with the beauty of our natural world. This, coupled with an understanding of the numerous threats it currently faces, motivated me to make a career where I could contribute towards conserving and rehabilitating our environment. I believe in the power of science to provide solutions to the most pressing environmental issues of our time.

My 'Eureka' moment came during my research on bio-luminescent organisms. I was trying to figure out the mechanism behind their glow for weeks with no breakthrough. Then one late-night, while cross-referencing several marine biology journals, I discovered an obscure paper that finally made the pieces fall into place. It turned out, these creatures contain a compound called luciferin, and when this interacts with another substance, luciferase â€“ it produces light! This was a truly exciting moment of scientific discovery for me.

topics: Do you like watching science TV programs?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions & Suggestions

What science TV programs do you enjoy watching? (Cosmos, Planet Earth, Nova)

Why do you find these programs appealing? (Informative content, high-quality visuals, fascinating stories)

When do you usually watch these programs? (Diffrent times: late nights, weekends, during meals)

Who do you usually watch these programs with? (Alone, family, friends, children)

How have these programs influenced your perception of science? (Broaden knowledge, increase interest in science, inspire curiosity)

Section 2: Example Answers

I find science TV programs, especially "Cosmos: A Spacetime Odyssey" and "Planet Earth", to be remarkably compelling. The depth of information provided and the stunning visuals tend to capture my attention. I usually watch these programs at night, as itâ€™s when I wind down, and I mostly watch them alone, immersing myself in the experience.

Science TV programs such as "Bill Nye Saves the World" and "Designated Survivor" satisfy my curiosity. I favor them because they are informative, yet entertaining. I often watch these shows during my leisure time, particularly during meals. These shows are often a topic of conversation between me and my friends.

As an enthusiast, I am enamored by a multitude of science TV programs, including "Origins: The Journey of Humankind" and "The Universe". They provide an intriguing mixture of storytelling and empirical data, which keeps me hooked. My children and I usually sit together for these shows over the weekend. These programs have significantly bolstered my interest and knowledge in science.

topics: Do Chinese people often visit science museums?
solutions:
Section one: WH-Questions and Suggestions in Phrases and Words

What percentage of Chinese citizens regularly visit science museums?

Suggestions: Statistics on museum attendance, science literacy rates

Where are the most popular science museums in China located?

Suggestions: Geographic locations, popularity rankings, city size

Why do Chinese people visit science museums?

Suggestions: Interest in science, education, family outing, traveler's spot

Who among Chinese citizens are more inclined to visit science museums?

Suggestions: Age demographics, education level

When do Chinese people prefer to visit science museums?

Suggestions: Holidays, weekends, special events, exhibitions

Section Two: Examples Answering the Question

A considerable number of Chinese people visit science museums, but exact figures could vary greatly depending upon the source. However, recent statistics point to an upward trend in museum attendance, with China's burgeoning middle class taking an increased interest in realms of culture and science. China's larger cities, such as Beijing and Shanghai, host a number of highly visited museums.

Chinese citizens frequently visit science museums for a number of reasons. Many see it as a great educational opportunity, especially for children, as it provides a tangible, interactive method of learning. It's also a popular leisure activity for families, particularly during holidays and special events.

The group most likely to visit science museums in China are families with young children and school trips, given the educational nature of these establishments. Additionally, affluent city residents and individuals with a high level of education also account for a significant portion of visitors, showing a higher inclination towards such cultural activities.

topics: Would you prefer an exciting holiday or a peaceful holiday?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What kind of activities would you enjoy on an exciting holiday versus a peaceful holiday?
For instance: hiking, exploring new cities, adrenaline sports versus reading, doing yoga, being in nature.

Where would you like to go if you choose an exciting holiday or a peaceful holiday?
E.g.: buzzing metropolis, mountainous adventure landscapes versus serene beaches, calm countryside.

Who would be your company on an exciting holiday versus a peaceful holiday?
Examples: friends, like-minded adventurers versus family, significant other.

When would you prefer to experience an exciting holiday verses a peaceful holiday?
Example: during a busy season like summer or quieter times like autumn.

Section 2: Example Responses

I'd prefer a peaceful holiday. What I'm imagining is spending my days reading and practicing yoga on a serene beach somewhere warm and sunny. Where I'd consider going is a quiet island or a tranquil countryside. Who I'd like to be there with me is my spouse, away from the hustle and bustle. When I'd go is perhaps during the autumn season when it's not overly crowded.

I'd choose an exciting holiday. What I'd love to do includes exploring new cities, trying out local foods and ideally participating in adrenaline sports like bungee jumping or white-water rafting. The where for me would be a buzzing city or somewhere with challenging mountainous terrains. And Who else but my adventurous friends to partake in this fun trip! I think summer would be the when for such an action-packed holiday.

I'm leaning towards an exciting holiday. What this means for me is not only visiting other countries but truly immersing myself in their culture and festivities. I envision the where would be vibrant locales like Barcelona or Delhi. The who in this scenario would perhaps be my like-minded colleagues who also love to explore the world. The ideal when would likely be during festive seasons when these places are at their liveliest.

topics: Do you prefer a leisurely or a busy holiday?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What do you envision when you think of a leisurely holiday compared to a busy holiday?

Suggestions: Lie on a beach, hiking, mountain climbing, city touring, immerse in local culture

Where are your favorite spots for a relaxing or adventurous vacation?

Suggestions: Tropical islands, historic cities, mountainous areas, scenic countryside

Who would be your ideal company for a leisurely or busy holiday?

Suggestions: Family, friends, alone, traveling groups, significant other

Section 2: Sample Answers

I am inclined towards a leisurely holiday. For me, a holiday is an opportunity to relax and recharge. What I envision when I think of a leisurely holiday is lying on a tropical beach with a coconut drink in hand. My favorite relaxation spots are the Maldives and Tahiti. When it comes to company, I prefer to be with my significant other, enjoying the tranquil surroundings and each other's company.

My preference is for a busy holiday. I am an adventure junkie and a passionate traveler. What a holiday means to me is an opportunity to explore new places and cultures. I love the adrenaline rush that comes from activities like mountain climbing or city touring in historical cities. My favorite travel destinations are the mountains of Switzerland and the historic cities of Italy. Who I'd want to be with would ideally be my like-minded friends.

I typically prefer a balance of both leisurely and busy holidays. What I look for in a holiday is a mix of serenity and adventure. For instance, I dream of spending the day exploring a historic city, then coming back to a cozy cottage for relaxation - perhaps in the scenic countryside of France or the lively cityscape of Barcelona. As for who I'd want to come with me, it could be anyone from family to friends, depending on the kind of trip.

topics: Do you like to spend your day at home?
solutions:
WH-Questions Suggestions:
- Why do you enjoy spending your day at home? (peace, quiet, relaxation, free time) - What do you do at home all day? (reading, watching TV, cooking, playing games, working) - When do you like to stay at home the most? (weekends, festive periods, holiday) - Which aspect of being at home you enjoy the most? (control over environment, comfort)

Examples:
- I really enjoy spending my day at home because it offers me peace and quiet away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. There's something satisfying about not having to rush around and just being able to relax in your own space. Plus, I get to enjoy my hobbies like reading, cooking and playing video games. I would say I enjoy staying at home the most during the weekends, because who doesn't love a lazy Sunday?

- I prefer to stay at home due to the control I have over my environment. No noise, no crowds, no dust, and no distractions. My typical day at home is usually spent in front of my computer, working. I especially like to spend my holidays at home. It's the perfect time to relax, unwind, and get some much-needed personal time.

- Being at home gives me a level of comfort that I can't easily find elsewhere. My couch, my kitchen, my bed and my favorite book â€“ it's an adventure on its own. I am an introvert, so I prefer having quiet time, especially over the weekends or during festive periods. It gives me the opportunity to recharge, relax, and prepare for the upcoming week.

topics: What do you do on holidays?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What activities do you participate in during your holidays?

Suggestions: sightseeing, beach vacation, hiking, skiing, spending time with family, shopping, local festivals, concerts

Where do you usually go on holiday?

Suggestions: beach, mountains, foreign countries, hometown, family visits, city staycation, amusement parks, nature trips

Who you typically spend your holidays with?

Suggestions: family, friends, partner, alone, colleagues, travel groups

How do you usually spend your holidays?

Suggestions: relaxation, adventures, learning new skills, volunteering, self-improvement, attending events, culinary journey

Section 2: Example Answers

I generally spend my holidays with my family. We often go back to our hometown, where we participate in local festivals and visit our extended family. We also enjoy sightseeing in the nearby countryside, which offers a peaceful break from our daily city life.

During my holidays, I enjoy solo travel. I often choose to go somewhere by the sea, as I love beach vacations. My activities usually include sightseeing, exploring local food culture, and attending concerts. Traveling alone gives me the freedom to do what I want and a chance to learn new things.

I usually spend my holidays with my friends. We are fond of adventurous trips, so we often go hiking or skiing in the mountains. We also participate in outdoor activities for tourists. It's always fun to combine physical activity and exploration, making these holidays exciting and unforgettable.

topics: Which public holiday do you like best?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What about the holiday do you enjoy most? (Consider elements such as the traditional food, activities, the general mood, etc.)

When is the holiday celebrated and how does the season or time of year affect your enjoyment? (Consider weather conditions, convenience, etc.)

Who do you usually spend the holiday with? (Consider friends, family, community, etc.)

Where do you usually celebrate the holiday? (Consider home, abroad, a specific destination, etc.)

Why do you favor this holiday over others? (Consider personal memories, traditions, values, etc.)

Section 2: Example Answers

My favorite public holiday would have to be Thanksgiving. What I enjoy most about it is the unity it inspires in people, coupled with the hearty traditional meals. Additionally, the holiday comes in the fall which is my favorite season and that when question adds more charm. Who I'm with also plays an important role, as I normally spend time with my family, sharing stories and creating memories. Plus, we always celebrate at our family home in the countryside, and the where aspect of home and nature combined is hard to beat. Why I love it over other holidays? Because it allows me to express my gratitude for what I have.

I absolutely adore Christmas. The what that attracts me to this holiday is a blend of delightful music, colorful decorations, and the joy of gift giving. I love the chill of winter, when the holiday takes place; there is something magical about the combination of Christmas lights and snowfall. Christmas for me is a gathering time, who makes it special, my entire family and close friends. Usually, we celebrate Christmas where in our grandparent's house, always beautifully decorated. And why is it my favorite? Because it's a season of love, joy, and spreading happiness.

My favorite public holiday is Independence Day. What draws me to this holiday is the sense of patriotism, unity, fireworks, and barbecues. It occurs in the summer, when the weather is usually perfect for outdoor activities. The who is usually with my friends and family, sometimes with my local community at a larger event. Many times, we go to a park or a beach, where we set picnic and spend the day together. And why I prefer it over other holidays? It's a reminder of the freedom and rights we should treasure.

topics: Do you like holidays? Why?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggestions

What aspects of holidays do you enjoy the most?

Suggestions: relaxation, spending time with family, traveling, cultural experiences, festivities, food, and traditions

Why do you look forward to holidays?

Suggestions: relief from work stress, quality family time, new experiences, rest and rejuvenation, change of routine

Which holiday do you like best and why?

Suggestions: Christmas, Thanksgiving, Easter, summer vacation, because of family reunion, festive spirit, religious significance, traditions etc.

Section 2: Examples answering the question

Yes, I certainly enjoy holidays. What I appreciate most about them is the chance to travel and experience new cultures. It opens my mind and broadens my perspective on various aspects of life. It's always exciting and rejuvenating.

Indeed, I am fond of holidays. The reason why I eagerly await them is the opportunity to spend quality time with my family. These rare, undisturbed moments are priceless. The laughter, stories, and shared experiences bring us closer and create memories we cherish for a lifetime.

Absolutely, I love holidays. Among all, my favorite is Christmas. Which is so because it carries a unique festive spirit. Love, joy, and peace fill the atmosphere. Besides, giving and receiving gifts, decorating the Christmas tree, and the warmth of the family reunion make it a holiday to look forward to every year.

topics: Where did you go for your last holiday?
solutions:
WH-questions and Suggestions

Where did you visit? (e.g. Rome, a secluded cabin in the mountains, Mom's house in my hometown)

Who did you go with? (e.g. I went by myself, went with my family, my best friend)

What was the purpose of your trip? (e.g. relaxation, family visit, adventure, exploring history and culture)

What did you do there? (e.g. hiking, skiing, visited museums, culinary journey)

Examples

I visited Rome for my last holiday. I took the trip by myself as a sort of self-discovery and exploration journey. Besides exploring the city's rich history and unique culture, I also enjoyed their culinary delights especially the pasta and gelato.

I went to a secluded cabin in the mountains for my last holiday. My family joined me on this trip. Our main purpose was to relax and escape from the city's hustle and bustle. We went hiking and spent quality time cooking and playing board games.

For my last holiday, I went to my Mom's house in my hometown. It was a family visit; a time to catch up with my siblings and relatives. We organized family events, cooked and ate so much, and visited our old childhood spots. It was indeed a nostalgic experience.

topics: Are you a cool-headed person?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestion

What situations cause you stress, and how do you handle them? - List events that lead to your anxiety and explain your strategies to control them.

When have you demonstrated calmness in a challenging scenario? - Narrate instances where you maintained composure in difficult situations.

How do you manage your emotions in a demanding environment? - Discuss your techniques for emotional self-regulation.

Section 2: Examples

In many situations, I am perceived as a cool-headed person. For instance, during my previous job as a project manager, unpredictable changes or short deadlines could cause simulating stress. Regardless, my approach was always to step back, assess the position objectively, strategize a plan, and implement it, instead of panicking and acting in haste.

One event where Iâ€™ve demonstrated calmness is during a significant crisis in my previous organization where our key customer threatened to withdraw their business. While the situation was tense, I treated this as a customer service issue. I remained calm, understood their concerns, and worked out a new proposal which eventually pleased the client and retained the business.

Working in a high-pressure sales environment gave me opportunities to manage my emotions effectively. When quotas were high, and timelines were tight, I often used deep breathing techniques, practiced mindfulness, and maintained a positive outlook, which helped me stay emotionally balanced, keeping both my team and myself motivated and focused on achieving targets.

topics: Do you often feel relaxed?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions in Phrases and Words

What activities help you feel relaxed?

Suggestions: reading a book, taking a walk, meditating

When do you feel the most relaxed?

Suggestions: after work, before bed, on weekends

Where do you feel most relaxed?

Suggestions: at home, at a park, at the beach

Who makes you feel relaxed?

Suggestions: family, friends, pets

Why do you feel relaxed in these situations?

Suggestions: escaping from daily stress, enjoying quiet time, feeling safe and comfortable

Section 2: Examples Answering the Question

I often feel relaxed during my daily yoga routine in the evening. Something about the combination of gentle movements and focused breathing really helps me unwind. Especially after an exhausting day, this practice provides great relief and a tranquil space for me to recharge.

Being at home, specifically in my lounge room with a good book, also makes me feel incredibly relaxed. There's a certain peace and calmness I find in these quiet moments. Regardless of the chaos that the day might have brought, immersing myself in a gripping story helps transport me to a more serene place.

Weekend hiking trips with my dog significantly contribute to my overall serene feeling. The natural environment, the rhythmic crunch of leaves underfoot, and the companionship of my loyal pet are the perfect recipe for relaxation. I often find myself unusually calm and relaxed even long after returning from these nature walks.

topics: Does listening to music make you feel relaxed?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggestions

What kind of music do you listen to for relaxation?

Suggestions: Classical, jazz, soft rock, ambient, nature sounds.

Why does music make you feel relaxed?

Suggestions: Stimulates brain, releases stress, impacts mood, calming rhythm, comforting lyrics.

When do you prefer to listen to music to feel relaxed?

Suggestions: After a long day, before sleep, whilst reading, during meditation.

Where do you often listen to music to feel relaxed?

Suggestions: On the bed, at home, in the park, in a quiet room.

Section 2: Examples of Answers to Questions

I generally listen to classical music, precisely Mozart or Beethoven, to feel relaxed. The classical tunes have a soothing rhythm that helps to clear my mind and relieve stress. I particularly prefer this type of music after a long and tiring day.

Music largely impacts my mood and helps me unwind. It stimulates my brain in a positive way and helps release stress. Especially when I listen to ambient sounds or calming nature sounds, it makes me feel more in sync with my surroundings, ultimately making me feel more peaceful and relaxed.

As for my preferred spot, I usually listen to soothing music in my room, it is quieter and more comfortable there. Often, I lie on my bed with my headphones on, letting the soft melodies carry me to a state of tranquility. It is part of my nightly routine before sleep, serving as a lullaby, aiding in a good night's sleep.

topics: What kinds of places or environments would make you feel relaxed?
solutions:
WH-Questions and Suggestions:

What natural environment makes you feel relaxed?

[forest, ocean, beach, mountains, lake, river]

Where do you feel most at peace?

[home, library, your own room, garden, park, spa]

What indoor settings help you relax?

[bookstore, coffee shop, art gallery, cozy living room, quiet study]

Which climate makes you feel the most relaxed?

[sunny, rainy, snowy, breezy, cloudy, warm]

What sounds or smells stimulate relaxation for you?

[rain sound, ocean wave, birds chirping, scent of coffee, aroma of fresh bread, lavender smell]

3 Examples Answering the Question:

I get incredibly relaxed when I'm in a natural environment, especially by the ocean. The sight of the vast sea and the sound of waves crashing have a soothing effect on my mind. I also love taking in the salty smell of the sea. This environment truly gives me a feeling of peace.

My personal sanctuary is my own room where I feel the most at peace. There's something comforting about being surrounded by things I love and that represent me. It's a place where I have complete control over my environment, from the temperature to the lighting, and the sound. The calm and coziness my room offers truly help me unwind and relax.

There is something about a quiet bookstore that always manages to make me feel relaxed. Walking through the shelves and browsing through books in absolute silence is a Zen-like experience for me. Moreover, the mild smell of books always has a calming effect on me. In this environment, I just forget about all my worries and lose myself in the world of books.

topics: Do you think students need more relaxing time?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What are the current amounts of schoolwork and extracurricular activities students are handling?

Suggestions: workload, homework, clubs, sports.

Why might students need more relaxing time?

Suggestions: reduce stress, boost creativity, improve mental health.

Where can students spend their relaxing time?

Suggestions: home, park, gym, hobby clubs.

When in the school timetable could more relaxing time be factored in?

Suggestions: longer lunch breaks, less homework, free periods.

Section 2: Example Answers

According to recent studies, the majority of students are struggling with a heavy workload which includes hours of homework plus additional extracurricular activities like clubs and sports. This workload significantly increases their stress levels and negatively affects their mental health. Therefore, students might need more relaxing time not only to reduce stress but also to boost their creativity.

Students could spend their newfound relaxing time at home, in a park, at the gym or in hobby clubs. These places provide comfortable environments for them to destress, explore their interests and recharge their energy. Relaxing time is not about being idle, but about engaging in activities they truly enjoy.

The school timetable could allow for more relaxing time by extending lunch breaks or scheduling in free periods. Reducing the amount of homework given to students could also free up more time for relaxation. Students would still learn the necessary material, but they would have more time to relax, resulting in a better work-life balance for students.

topics: Do you think vacation is a good time to relax?
solutions:
Section One: WH-Questions & Suggestions

Why would vacation be a good time to relax? (stress reduction, change of scenery, rest)

What activities during vacation could provide relaxation? (reading, nature walks, swimming, spa treatments)

Who benefits the most from relaxing vacations? (workers, students, parents)

Where are some locations that might be particularly relaxing? (beaches, mountains, rural areas)

When during the year would be the best time to take a relaxing vacation? (summer, winter, off-peak travel times)

Section Two: Answers

Vacation is often considered a good time to relax because it provides a much-needed break from everyday pressures. Why is it a good time to relax? People usually have less responsibilities and are more able to unwind, helping to decrease stress levels and promote overall wellbeing.

There are numerous activities we can engage in that may provide relaxation during vacation. For instance, What about afternoon reading by the pool or hiking through beautiful nature? Some might prefer indulging in spa treatments or simply doing nothing at all. The idea is to find whatever soothing activity makes the individual feel the most relaxed.

A vacation might be most beneficial for those who are usually very busy and under constant stress. Who might these be? Workers often dealing with severe deadlines, students in a difficult study period, or parents who could use some time to reconnect with themselves â€“ these are just a few examples of individuals who could benefit greatly from a relaxing vacation.

topics: Do you think doing sports is a good way to relax?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggestions

What are some sports that are good for relaxation?

Suggestions: yoga, tai chi, golf, jogging, swimming

How can doing sports help individuals to relax?

Suggestions: release of endorphins, taking mind off stressful situations, fresh air and nature

When is the best time to engage in sports for relaxation?

Suggestions: early in the morning, after work, weekends

Why are sports more effective for relaxation than other activities?

Suggestions: physical activity, community and team spirit, set and achieve goals

Section 2: Example Answers

Doing sports such as golf, jogging, and swimming are renowned for their relaxing qualities. They allow an individual to immerse themselves in a tranquil environment while providing a healthy physical activity. Furthermore, these sports offer a rhythmic, repetitive motion that can often induce a meditative state, aiding in relaxation.

Engaging in sports can help individuals to relax as they stimulate the release of endorphins, the body's natural mood boosters. Additionally, physical activity can assist in taking one's mind off stressful situations by promoting focus on the task at hand rather than on worrying thoughts. Moreover, sports such as hiking or cycling offer exposure to fresh air and nature which have been linked to lower stress levels.

Sports have the added benefit of being able to be integrated into daily routines as a regular form of relaxation and stress relief. Early in the morning or after work are ideal times to engage in sports activities, as these times allow for a break from the day's obligations. Also, taking part in sports during the weekend can provide an enjoyable escape from the workweek.

topics: What would you do to relax?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions to Consider

What are some activities you find calming?

Suggestions: Reading a book, taking a warm bath, gardening, painting, knitting, playing musical instruments

Where is a place that makes you feel relaxed?

Suggestions: Beach, park, library, yoga studio, backyard, spa

When do you find it easiest to relax?

Suggestions: Early morning, before bed, after exercise, on the weekend, during lunch break

Who do you relax best with?

Suggestions: Alone, with pets, with family, with friends, with significant other

Why is relaxation important for you?

Suggestions: Stress management, improve sleep, recharge energy, stay balanced, improve concentration

Section 2: Answering the Questions

One way I relax is by curling up with a good book in the early morning before anyone else is awake. The quiet solitude helps me clear my mind and start my day on a positive note. Reading transports me to different settings and situations, which takes my mind off any stressors.

For me, practicing yoga in my backyard in the late afternoon is a powerful way to relax. The combination of deep breathing, stretching, and the soothing sounds of nature brings tranquility and rejuvenation. Plus, it's an excellent method for me to stay fit and flexible.

I love taking my dogs out for a walk in a nearby park on weekends. The dogsâ€™ delight at exploring new smells and sounds, and their sheer joy of being outside is contagious. Plus, being in the middle of nature always has a calming effect on me, the fresh air and the greenery help me forget about my worries.

topics: Do numbers matter to you?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What kind of numbers are important to you? - financial numbers, statistics, personal records, counts.

When do numbers matter to you? - during work, during finances management, when keeping track of health.

Where do you apply numbers in your daily life? - at the office, in the gym, at home, shopping.

Why do numbers matter to you? - accuracy, precision, success measurements, record-breaking, benchmarks.

Section 2: Example Answers

Numbers are extremely important to me, especially financial numbers. As a business owner, I always keep a close eye on my revenue, expenses, and profits. The success of my business directly depends on these numbers, and so they significantly influence my strategies and decisions.

When I'm at the gym, numbers matter a lot as they help me track my progress. They help me set my fitness goals, such as the target weight I want to lift, the distance I want to run, or the number of calories I want to burn each day. Without these numbers, it would be impossible for me to know if I'm improving, staying the same, or getting worse.

Numbers matter to me when it comes to personal finance as well. I use numbers to budget my monthly income and spending, plan for future expenses, and save for retirement. Understanding these numbers is the key to financial independence and stability.

topics: Are you good at math?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggested Phrases/Words

What areas of math are you proficient in?

Suggested phrases/words: Calculus, Trigonometry, Linear Algebra, Probability and Statistics.

How did you become good at math?

Suggested phrases/words: practice, aptitude for numbers, good teachers, education.

Why do you consider yourself good at math?

Suggested phrases/words: score well in exams, solve complex problems, describe logic and processes clearly, intuition for patterns and solutions.

Section 2: Example Answers

I'm proficient in numerous areas of mathematics including Calculus, Trigonometry, Linear Algebra and Probability. My strong grasp of these subjects allowed me to excel in university level mathematics.

I became good at math through regular practice and an innate aptitude for numbers. I was fortunate to have some incredible teachers who nurtured my love for the subject. I also pursued an education in mathematics, which honed my skills further.

I consider myself good at math because I consistently score well on exams, can solve complex problems, and can clearly explain mathematical logic and processes. I have developed an intuition for spotting patterns and finding solutions, which has been key to my success in math.

topics: Do you usually use numbers?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggested Phrases or Words

What types of numbers do you often use in daily life? (Whole numbers, fractions, decimals, negative numbers, etc).

When do you use numbers? (At work, school, shopping, managing finances, etc).

Where do you use these numbers? (In office, at home, in supermarket, etc).

Why are numbers important in your daily activity? (For calculation, measurement, identification, etc).

Who taught you how to use numbers? (Parents, teacher, self-taught, etc).

Section 2: Examples of Answering the WH-questions

What: In my day-to-day life, I frequently use a variety of numbers. This includes whole numbers for basic counting and calculation, fractions when cooking or baking, and decimals while dealing with financial matters like splitting bills or calculating discounts.

When and Where: I use numbers constantly throughout my day. For example, at work, I use them for data analysis and strategic planning. At home, I use numbers for managing my personal finances, cooking, and even measuring furniture or other items. When I am shopping, I use numbers to compare prices and calculate discounts.

Why: Numbers are critical in my daily life because they help me make precise measurements, manage my finances, and make logical decisions. Operating without them would make most of my activities very challenging.

Who: My understanding of numbers started at a very early age when my parents first introduced me to counting. My understanding of numbers deepened during my school years, with teachers explaining more complex concepts like negative numbers, fractions, and decimals. In recent years, self-study and practical application have also helped me advance my numerical skills.

topics: Are you good at remembering phone numbers?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestion Phrases/Words

WH-Questions:

Who's phone number do you remember most readily?

What is your strategy for remembering phone numbers?

When did you begin to realize your capability in remembering phone numbers?

Where do you store important phone numbers?

Why do you think you are good at remembering phone numbers?

Suggested Phrases/Words:

Repetition, Flashcards, Writing down repeatedly, Visualizing numbers, Associating the numbers with significant life events

Section 2: Examples of Responses

I found out I was good at remembering phone numbers when I was about ten, and I kept track of all my friends' numbers without needing to write them down. I usually associate the numbers I remember most readily to important events or people in my life. Besides, I also make a point of repeating them in my mind to strengthen the memory.

My skill for remembering phone numbers came handy while I was working as an office assistant. As part of my job, I had to remember numerous client's and dealer's numbers. I quickly started to notice a pattern in my behavior; I visualize every number I hear or read and link it to something significant. For storing critical numbers, I use old-fashioned methods like writing them in a physical notebook.

The phone number that's easiest for me to recall is my mother's. I have been dialing it since I was a child, and it's deeply ingrained in my memory. To remember other phone numbers, I often use flashcards or write them down several times. Also, I find that repeating the numbers to myself helps to store them in my long-term memory.

topics: What's your favorite number?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggestions

What is special about your favorite number?

Suggestions: Unique properties, symbolism, personal significance.

When did you first choose your favorite number?

Suggestions: A significant event, a memorable year.

Where does your favorite number commonly appear?

Suggestions: Sports, studies, birthdates, addresses.

Why is this number your favorite?

Suggestions: Personal reasons, lucky events, special meaning.

Who else shares your favorite number?

Suggestions: Famous people, family members, friends.

Section 2: Examples

My favorite number is 7. What is special about it? It's often considered a lucky number in many cultures. When did I first favor it? After I had scored seven goals in a single soccer match in my youth. Where does it commonly appear? In my case, on my football jersey number. Why is it my favorite? Mainly because of its symbolism and it brings luck in my life.

I love the number 11. What is special about it? It's a prime number. I have always found prime numbers intrinsically fascinating because they only have two factors. When did I choose it? During my mathematics class in high school. Where does it appear? Occasionally in my mathematics problems. Why is it my favorite? Simply because of my passion for mathematics.

The number 5 is my favorite. What is special about it? It's the number of fingers I have on each hand and gives a sense of balance. When did I have a bond with it? When I was a child learning to count. Where does it appear? Mainly in my daily life counting and calculations. Why is this my favorite? It reminds me of human capacity and potential.

topics: What do you think if someone gives you a pen or pencil as a present?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What does this pen or pencil mean to you?

Suggestions: Symbol of creativity, tool for my job, simple minimalist beauty.

Who gave you this pen or pencil?

Suggestions: Friend, family member, colleague, boss.

Why do you think they gave you this pen or pencil?

Suggestions: Appreciation, encouragement, celebration of a special occasion.

How does receiving this pen or pencil make you feel?

Suggestions: Grateful, appreciated, encouraged, surprised.

When did you receive this pen or pencil?

Suggestions: On a birthday, at a company event, during a holiday, as a casual surprise.

Section 2: Examples Answering the Questions

The pen given to me is more than a simple writing tool; it symbolizes my passion for writing that my friend recognizes. They know about my love for storytelling and gave me this pen as an appreciation of that. It makes me feel seen and inspired every time I see it. I received it last week as a surprise which makes it even more special.

The pencil I received was a gift from my boss. It's not just a pencil, to me, it represents recognition of the work I do as a graphic designer. My boss gave it to me to encourage my creativity and to show appreciation for my efforts. I felt elated and motivated when I got the pencil during our annual company event.

I got this pen from my brother on my birthday. As a journalist, a pen is an important part of my profession. The pen reflects his understanding and support for my job. His gesture makes me feel loved and respected. Each time I use the pen, it's a reminder of this support.

topics: Do you usually use a pen or a pencil?
solutions:
Section One: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What specific tasks do you usually use a pen or pencil for?

Suggestions: note taking, sketching, writing letters, filling out forms

Where do you often use a pen or a pencil?

Suggestions: work, school, home, art studio

When do you tend to use a pen versus a pencil?

Suggestions: permanent writing, temporary notes, when creating art

Why do you prefer using a pen or a pencil for certain tasks?

Suggestions: easy to erase mistakes, smoother writing, sharper lines

Section Two: Example Responses

I find that I mostly use a pencil for tasks that involve note taking or creating temporary notes. I like that I can easily erase any mistakes made. However, for confirmed thoughts or permanent writing, I use a pen. It makes my writing look neater and smoother.

During school hours, I use a pen to take notes and write assignments. It helps me keep track of my thoughts and make my work look professional. At home or my art studio, I prefer using a pencil especially for sketching as it allows me to create sharper lines and shading.

I use a pen chiefly in my office for work-related tasks such as filling out forms or writing official letters. It ensures that the content I write is permanent and cannot be easily changed. Alternatively, I use a pencil for tasks that are not as formal like making to-do lists or jotting down ideas in meetings.

topics: When was the last time you bought a pen or pencil?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-questions and Suggestions

When did you purchase your last pen or pencil?
Suggestions: Recall the date, period or event.

Where did you buy your last pen or pencil from?
Suggestions: Name of the shop, online or offline, city.

What was the reason for buying that pen or pencil?
Suggestions: Personal use, gift, project, lost an old one.

Which type of pen or pencil did you buy?
Suggestions: Mechanical pencil, ballpoint pen, fountain pen, lead size & color of the ink.

Who did you buy the pen or pencil for?
Suggestions: For self, for friend, for parent, sibling or colleague.

Section 2: Examples

I purchased my last pen this past Tuesday. It was a black, ballpoint pen that I bought from a local stationery shop. I needed a new pen for my office, as I had misplaced the one I was using. So it was for personal use.

Around a month ago, I bought a blue, gel pen from an online marketplace. The main reason for buying this pen was that I had to give a gift to my younger cousin, who loves stationery items. Hence, I bought it for her.

I purchased a mechanical pencil about two weeks ago. I bought it from a Staples store in the city. I needed it for a design project I was working on. The pencil had a sharp, 0.5mm lead which is perfect for precise sketches.

topics: Which do you use more often? Pen or pencil?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What types of work do you do most often that require writing?

Suggestions: Note taking, sketching, documentation work, calculation work, writing checks, grades, etc.

Why do you prefer using a pen or pencil?

Suggestions: More comfortable, easier to erase errors, looks more professional, less smudging, etc.

When do you often use a pen or pencil?

Suggestions: During meetings, when doing homework, when drawing, etc.

Section 2: Example Answers

I tend to use a pen more often, mainly because my daily tasks involve a lot of note-taking and documentation work. I find it more comfortable to write with and it makes my handwriting clear and professional. Furthermore, I often use a pen during meetings or when writing checks as it makes the text permanent and harder to erase thus minimising chances of fraud.

I frequently use a pencil because my job involves a lot of rough sketching and calculation work. It allows me to easily correct any mistakes without leaving visible traces. Additionally, I prefer using a pencil when I am doing my homework or drawing sketches because it helps me attain a certain level of precision and I am able to control the darkness of the lines.

My work routine revolves around using both, but I would say I use a pen more frequently. I have to sign a lot of documents and write in meeting minutes where a pen is more appropriate. However, when I'm brainstorming ideas or drafting layouts for design work, I prefer using a pencil, as it allows for easy adjustments and changes.

topics: Do you have anything to share with others recently?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What is the most exciting thing that you did recently? Suggestions: Attended a concert, started learning a new skill, tried a new workout routine, etc.

Who have you met recently that made a significant impact on you? Suggestions: An inspiring speaker, a helpful colleague, a kind stranger, etc.

Where have you visited recently that you found interesting? Suggestions: A new city, a historical site, a unique restaurant, etc.

Section 2: Examples of Answers

Recently, I attended a Coldplay concert which was an absolutely electric experience. The music was fantastic and lighting effects were incredible. I went with a group of friends and we had an amazing time dancing and cheering. It was definitely the most exciting thing that happened to me recently.

I recently met an inspiring individual at a conference I attended for work. She was a keynote speaker who talked about overcoming challenges to achieve professional success. Her story resonated with me and had a big influence on my perspective towards overcoming my own personal challenges. It was definitely a significant encounter.

A couple of weeks ago I visited the ancient city of Rome. The city's historical importance coupled with its vibrant contemporary culture left me awe-inspired. Through walking tours, I got to see and learn much about the Colosseum, the Roman Forum and Trevi Fountain among other places. It was an absolutely interesting trip that I would love to relive.

topics: What kind of things are not suitable for sharing?
solutions:
Unsuitable things for sharing

What personal and private items should you not share with others? Some suggestions include: Toothbrushes, cosmetics, undergarments.

Why is it not advisable to share confidential information? People may misuse the information or it may lead to the loss of privacy and trust.

When should you refrain from sharing certain items? When they have been in contact with fluids or parts of the body that could transmit illnesses or spread infections.

Who should you not share your passwords with? In most cases, passwords are not to be shared with anyone unless justified, as it can lead to unauthorized access or cyber theft.

Examples of things not suitable for sharing:

Personal hygiene items such as toothbrushes and razors should not be shared. These items are in direct contact with parts of our bodies that can harbor bacteria and viruses. Sharing them could lead to the spread of infections and diseases such as cold sores, lice, or even Hepatitis B.

Confidential information like passwords, financial data, and medical records is also not acceptable to share. This is because sharing such pieces of information can lead to identity theft, loss of money or property, and other severe consequences. Moreover, sharing such data could be a violation of the law or the terms of your agreement with certain entities like banks and health providers.

In many cases, it's inappropriate to share personal items that directly touch the skin, such as undergarments and cosmetics. Sharing these items can spread skin infections, allergic reactions, or even contagious diseases. In addition, sharing such items is generally considered unhygienic and a violation of personal boundaries.

topics: What kind of things do you like to share with others?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What kind of hobbies or interests do you enjoy sharing with others? (books you love, sports, cooking recipes, movies)

Why do you enjoy sharing these interests with others? (spread joy, educate friends, spark conversations, big part of your life)

Who do you usually share these interests with? (family, friends, colleagues, online communities)

When do you find is the best time to share these interests? (during gatherings, when someone asks, casual conversations, online)

Where do you usually share these things? (at home, social media, clubs, workplace, parties)

Section 2: Examples

I like to share my love for reading with others, especially the books in the genre of mystery and thriller. I enjoy sparking deep, thought-provoking conversations with my friends. I usually share my latest reads and recommendations with my book club members, usually during our monthly meetings where we analyze and discuss our chosen book of the month.

I enjoy sharing my passion for cooking with others. I find so much joy in watching others enjoy the meals that I've prepared. I share my latest recipes with my family and friends during gatherings. I love enhancing the celebration by contributing a delicious dish and making people happy with my cooking.

I have a strong interest in fitness, I share workout tips with my colleagues who are also fitness enthusiasts. We often discuss it during breaks at our workplace where we motivate each other to stay healthy and fit. I find sharing these interests quite enjoyable as it strengthens our camaraderie and also helps us maintain good physical health while balancing our hectic job.

topics: Did your parents teach you to share when you were a child?
solutions:
Section One: WH-Questions with word and phrase suggestions

Who first initiated the conversation about sharing? (parents, sibling, teacher)

What was your reaction when taught about sharing? (happiness, confusion, resistance)

Where did you primarily practice sharing? (home, school, playground)

When did you start learning about sharing? (early childhood, elementary school)

Why did your parents emphasize sharing? (building character, understanding empathy, social adaptability)

Section Two: Example Answers

My parents were the ones who first emphasized the importance of sharing. They initiated the conversation when I became noticeably protective of my new toys. They prioritized teaching me this principle at home, before I embarked on my schooling journey. Their belief was that sharing fosters a sense of empathy and they wanted to inculcate that value early.

As an only child, the concept of sharing was entirely new to me. I initially resisted letting go of my toys, even for a few minutes. This instruction was primarily given in our home, before involving other settings like the playground or the school. My parents believed sharing was important for developing social adaptability and to engage creatively with others.

If I think back, it was my Kindergarten teacher who took on the task of teaching me the value of sharing in a structured manner. My reaction was not surprising, a feeling of discomfort at first, largely because my sharing lessons were practiced mostly at school. The emphasis on sharing from both my parents and my teacher was driven by the idea that sharing builds character and fosters respect for others.

topics: Do you like to get up early in the morning?
solutions:
Section 1: WH-Questions and Suggestions

What are the reasons you like or dislike to get up early in the morning?

Suggestions: Refreshing morning air, quietude, productivity, dislike early morning alarm clock, not a morning person

Who or what influences your decision to get up early or not?

Suggestions: Job schedule, school, family responsibilities, personal preference, fitness goals.

How do you feel after getting up early?

Suggestions: Energized, fresh, tired, groggy, accomplished.

Section 2: Examples of Answers

I do like to get up early in the morning because I enjoy the tranquility of the early hours. I find it is the best time for me to focus and be productive. Plus, I love the freshness of the morning air. However, I do struggle when the alarm goes off.

I don't particularly enjoy waking up early. This is mostly influenced by my job which requires me to work late hours, making it hard to rise early. I also find I am more productive and creative during the evening hours, so I prefer to sleep in when I can.

You could say I am a half-and-half kind of person. Some days, depending on my schedule or commitments, I need to get up early and I quite enjoy those days. It makes me feel accomplished and ready to tackle the day. But, not gonna lie, I do enjoy my sleep-in days where I get up later and start my day at a more leisurely pace.

topics: What is your morning routine?
solutions:
Morning Routine

Section 1 - WH-Questions and Suggestions:

1. What time do you usually get up in the morning? - Suggestions: Early in the morning before sunrise, late in the morning, specific time. 2. Why do you get up at that time? - Suggestions: To prepare for work, to have a calm start to the day, to make the most of the day. 3. How do you start your day? - Suggestions: With a cup of coffee, by exercising, by meditating. 4. Who do you first interact with in the morning? - Suggestions: Family members, pet, colleagues online. 5. When do you start your work or school? - Suggestions: After breakfast, after a morning run, specific time.

Section 2 - Example Answers:

1.

I usually get up at 6 a.m. in the morning. I wake up that early to prepare for the day and have a calm start before the hustle begins. I start my day with a 10-minute meditation session to clear my mind and prepare for the tasks ahead. The first person I interact with in the morning is usually my husband over breakfast. I start my work right after breakfast, at about 7:30 a.m.

2.

I typically wake up around 7 a.m.. I choose to get up this time as it allows me a good amount of sleep while also giving me enough time to get ready for work or school. My day often kicks off with a brisk 20-minute run which leaves me feeling refreshed and energised. The first interaction I usually have in the morning is with my flatmate over a shared breakfast. I start engaging with my work or school obligations after a quick shower, at around 8 a.m.

3.

My alarm clock usually rings at 5:30 a.m., which is when I wake up. This early wake-up enables me to have some quiet, focused time before the world wakes up. I like to jump-start my day with some yoga, which helps me stay centred and balanced. More often than not, the first being I interact with in the morning is my cat, Mr. Sprinkles, who likes to join in my yoga routine. I start my work or school at 7 a.m., after having breakfast and a quick shower.

topics: Is breakfast important?
solutions:
Section 1: Suggested WH-Questions and Phrases

What are the benefits of eating breakfast?

Suggestions: Enhances concentration, weight management, nutrition intake.

Why is breakfast considered the most important meal of the day?

Suggestions: Jumpstart metabolism, fuel for the body, affect mood and energy level throughout the day.

Where did the concept that breakfast is the most important meal come from?

Suggestions: Historical origins, cultural influences, health studies.

Who benefit the most from having breakfast?

Suggestions: Students, athletes, working professionals, individuals with specific health conditions.

How does skipping breakfast impact our health and day?

Suggestions: Can cause overeating, weight gain, tiredness, decreased cognitive function.

Section 2: Examples Answering the Question

Eating breakfast brings numerous benefits such as enhanced concentration, balanced weight, and increased intake of crucial nutrients. A full, nutritious breakfast helps individuals focus, manage their weight effectively, and ensure they are getting the vitamins and minerals they need for optimal health.

The belief in breakfast being the most important meal dates back to various cultural and historical origins and is supported by many health studies. Having breakfast helps jumpstart our metabolism, providing the fuel our body needs for the day. It can substantially influence our mood and energy levels, setting a positive tone for the rest of the day.

Skipping breakfast can lead to various health issues and negatively impact our day. It can result in overeating later in the day, resulting in weight gain. Furthermore, missing the morning meal can lead to feelings of tiredness and a decrease in cognitive function, affecting our productivity and efficiency in our daily tasks.

topics: What do you do right after getting up in the morning?
solutions:
WH-Questions and Suggestions

What is the first thing you do after waking up?

Suggestions: Exercise, meditate, shower, grab a cup of coffee, stretch.

When do you wake up in the morning?

Suggestions: Early before sunrise, at 6 am, at 7 am, around 8 am, late in the morning.

Who do you interact with first thing in the morning?

Suggestions: Spouse, children, roommate, pets, nobody.

Where do you go first after getting up?

Suggestions: Bathroom, kitchen, living room, gym, yoga mat.

Why do you start your morning in this way?

Suggestions: Boost energy, maintain health, complete personal tasks, get ready for work.
Example Answers

As soon as I get up in the morning, which is usually around 6 am, I go straight to my kitchen to grab a cup of coffee. It's always nice to start the day with a quiet coffee moment before the rest of the house wakes up. This routine helps me mentally prepare for the day.

Right after waking up, I go to my gym room for a short yoga session. I find this routine important as it boosts my energy and mood for the day. The best part is that it's usually just me and my dog at this time, which adds a touch of peace and tranquility to this routine.

The moment I wake up, I head towards the bathroom and start my day with a refreshing shower. The first person I interact with in the morning would typically be my spouse as we prepare breakfast together. This routine is not only a good chance for us to have a chat but also beneficial for maintaining our health.

topics: Do Chinese people send plants as gifts?
solutions:
WH-questions and Suggestions in Phrases and Words

What kind of plants are commonly gifted in Chinese culture? 'Lucky bamboo' 'Jade plant' 'Citrus trees'

Why do Chinese people gift plants? Feng Shui beliefs, housewarming, Lunar New Year

When are these types of gifts commonly given? Holidays, family celebrations, business opening

How are these plants prepared or presented as gifts? Plant arrangements, decorated pots, paired with red envelopes

Examples

Chinese people often gift plants, especially those they believe bring some form of good fortune. The 'Lucky Bamboo', for instance, is a common gift due to its associations with prosperity and good luck in Feng Shui. It is often given during housewarming parties or during the Lunar New Year celebrations.
